beginnerTips.1.text: Most monsters only come out at night. During the day you're safe... probably.

beginnerTips.10.text: Be careful when you swim. Stay under water for too long and you'll run out of air.

beginnerTips.11.text: Survival mode has 4 different difficulty levels - Peaceful, Easy, Normal, and Hard. Or play Creative mode and get endless resources!

beginnerTips.12.text: The world of Minecraft is endlessly surprising. You'll find lots of different animals, plants, and even §f§k§a§b§r §f§k§a§b§r

beginnerTips.2.text: Break blocks, pick up resources. Use the crafting grid to make helpful items. Now you're crafting!

beginnerTips.3.text: You have endless lives, but your items drop to the ground when you die. Hurry back to pick them up!

beginnerTips.4.text: It's a good idea to build a place where you can safely spend the night.

beginnerTips.5.text: Use the right tool for the job! Chopping wood with an axe is much faster than using your hands.

beginnerTips.6.text: Even in Minecraft you'll get hungry, so try to find something to eat before that happens.

beginnerTips.7.text: Digging straight down or straight up might not be a great idea.

beginnerTips.8.text: Monsters spawn in the dark. Craft a torch to brighten up any space.

beginnerTips.9.text: Beds are great! Craft one to quickly pass the night and set your respawn point.

howtoplay.addons.text.1.text: Add-Ons are a content type available in the Minecraft Marketplace that lets you add custom blocks, items, mobs, recipes, and other game content to your world.

howtoplay.addons.text.2.text: Add-Ons allow you to modify your existing worlds and Realms through the Edit World screen and the Create New World screen.

howtoplay.addons.text.3.text: Stacking, or adding multiple Add-Ons, can increase loading times, and could result in unexpected results.

howtoplay.addons.text.4.text: We recommend that you save a copy of your world or Realm before adding or removing Add-Ons.

howtoplay.addons.text.5.text: For more information about how you can make the most out of Add-Ons, you can visit our FAQ page.

howtoplay.adventureMode.text.1.text: Adventure Mode is a gamemode for world builders. In Adventure Mode, players must use special tools to place or break blocks.

howtoplay.adventureMode.text.2.text: To get these special tools, you must use §e/give§f with §ecanplace§f or §ecandestroy§f parameters while in creative mode.

howtoplay.anvil.text.1.text: Experience Levels can be used to repair, enchant, or rename items with the Anvil.

howtoplay.anvil.text.2.text: All items can be renamed, although only items with durability can be repaired or enchanted with Books on the Anvil.

howtoplay.anvil.text.3.text: An item can be repaired by placing it in one of the input slots on the left, along with either some raw materials of the item, like Iron Ingots for an Iron Sword, or combined with another item of the same type.

howtoplay.anvil.text.4.text: Combining items is more efficient when done with an Anvil.

howtoplay.anvil.text.5.text: There is a chance that the Anvil will be damaged with each use and after enough usage it will be destroyed.

howtoplay.armor.text.1.text: By wearing Armor, you can protect yourself from incoming damage. Your Armor level is represented by :armor: on the HUD, the higher the level, the less damage you will take.

howtoplay.armor.text.2.text: Armor can be crafted from Leather, Iron, Gold, or Diamond. Chainmail Armor can be obtained through villager trading and loot from zombies and skeletons.

howtoplay.armor.text.3.text: Equip Armor by opening your inventory and moving pieces of Armor to the appropriate slot next to your player skin.

howtoplay.armor.text.4.text: Iron, Chain, and Gold Armor can be smelted into Iron or Gold Nuggets in a Furnace.

howtoplay.armor.text.5.gamepad.text: The Shield will block incoming damage. The Shield can be equipped in the offhand slot as well as the hotbar. Press :_input_key.sneak: or press :_gamepad_stick_right: to toggle block with the Shield.

howtoplay.armor.text.5.keyboard.text: The Shield will block incoming damage. The Shield can be equipped in the offhand slot as well as the hotbar. Press and hold :_input_key.sneak: to block with the Shield.

howtoplay.armor.text.5.rift_controller.text: The Shield will block incoming damage. The Shield can be equipped in the offhand slot as well as the hotbar. Press :_input_key.sneak: or click :rift_X: to toggle block with the Shield.

howtoplay.armor.text.5.windowsmr_control.text: The Shield will block incoming damage. The Shield can be equipped in the offhand slot as well as the hotbar. Press :_input_key.sneak: or click :windowsmr_right_stick: to toggle block with the Shield.

howtoplay.armor.text.5a.touch.text: The Shield blocks all kinds of incoming damage - even a Creeper explosion! It can be equipped in the offhand slot or the hotbar.

howtoplay.armor.text.5b.touch.text: When using the "D-Pad & tap to interact" control scheme, tap :touch_sneak: to toggle blocking with the shield.

howtoplay.armor.text.5c.touch.text: When using a "Joystick" control scheme, tap :tip_virtual_button_sneak: to toggle blocking with the shield.

howtoplay.armor.text.6.text: The Shield can even block a Creeper explosion!

howtoplay.armor.text.7.text: You can also wear a Carved Pumpkin on your head. This won't give you any :armor: but will make it so Endermen won't get mad when you look at them.

howtoplay.armorStand.text.1.text: An Armor Stand holds your armor while you aren't using it.

howtoplay.armorStand.text.2.notTouch.text: Press :_input_key.use: on an Armor Stand while holding a piece of armor to place it on the Armor Stand.

howtoplay.armorStand.text.2.touch.text: Tap an Armor Stand while holding a piece of armor to place it on the Armor Stand.

howtoplay.armorStand.text.3.notTouch.text: Press :_input_key.use: on an Armor Stand with an open hand to remove something from the Armor Stand.

howtoplay.armorStand.text.3.touch.text: Tap an Armor Stand with an open hand to remove something from the Armor Stand.

howtoplay.armorStand.text.4.notTouch.text: An Armor Stand can change its pose, sneak and press :_input_key.use: on an Armor Stand to change the pose.

howtoplay.armorStand.text.4.touch.text: An Armor Stand can change its pose, sneak and tap an Armor Stand to change the pose.

howtoplay.armorStand.text.5.text: Armor Stands will react to a Redstone signal, try giving it different signal strengths and see what happens.

howtoplay.banners.text.1.text: Banners are a cool way to decorate your house or castle with custom patterns and colors.

howtoplay.banners.text.2.text: After crafting a Banner, you can put it on a Crafting Table or Loom and add different dyes to create your own unique, cool design!

howtoplay.banners.text.3.text: There are many different patterns that you can create with your dye such as:

howtoplay.banners.text.4.text: - Making a triangle will give you a chevron pattern.

howtoplay.banners.text.5.text: - Making a cross gives you a cross pattern.

howtoplay.banners.text.6.text: - Adding a Oxeye Daisy gives you a flower pattern.

howtoplay.banners.text.7.text: Experiment with different combinations to get even more patterns!

howtoplay.banners.text.8.text: A Banner can also have multiple layers, allowing you to have more than one pattern on your Banner. If you don't like the last pattern you put on a Banner, you can wash the last layer off in a Cauldron.

howtoplay.banners.text.9.text: If you want to copy a Banner, put it on the Crafting Table with a blank Banner.

howtoplay.beacons.text.1.text: Active Beacons project a bright beam of light into the sky.

howtoplay.beacons.text.2.text: They are crafted with Glass, Obsidian, and Nether Stars (which is obtained by defeating the Wither).

howtoplay.beacons.text.3.text: Beacons need to be on top of a Pyramid of Iron, Gold, Emerald, Diamond, or Netherite blocks with an unobstructed view of the sky.

howtoplay.beacons.text.4.text: The material that the Beacon is placed on has no effect on the power of the Beacon.

howtoplay.beacons.text.5.text: In the Beacon menu you can select one primary power for your Beacon. The more tiers your pyramid has the more powers you can have.

howtoplay.beacons.text.6.text: To set the powers of your Beacon you must use a Netherite Ingot, Emerald, Diamond, Gold Ingot, or Iron Ingot in the payment slot.

howtoplay.beacons.text.7.text: Once set, the powers will emanate from the Beacon indefinitely. Powers are granted to all nearby players.

howtoplay.beacons.text.8.text: To change the color of the beam, place a stained glass block in its path.

howtoplay.beds.text.1.text: Sleeping in a Bed passes the night and sets your spawn point.

howtoplay.beds.text.2.notTouch.text: Press :_input_key.use: on a Bed to go to sleep. This can only be done at night.

howtoplay.beds.text.2.touch.text: Tap a Bed to go to sleep. This can only be done at night.

howtoplay.beds.text.3.text: If you are playing Multiplayer, everyone in the world must be in a Bed at the same time to pass the night.

howtoplay.beds.text.4.text: If your Bed is broken you will return to where you first spawned into the world.

howtoplay.beds.text.5.text: Be careful when using a Bed in the Nether, it's usually too hot to sleep.

howtoplay.bedsNew.text.1.text: A soft bed lets you sleep through the night. You'll need wool to craft one, as well as a safe spot to place it.

howtoplay.bedsNew.text.2.text: Sleeping in a bed will also set your §espawn point§f, meaning that if you die, you'll reappear right back home!

howtoplay.bedsNew.text.3.text: You can only fall asleep when it's cozy, like when it's nighttime or during a thunderstorm.

howtoplay.blocks.text.1.text: The world of Minecraft is made from millions of blocks. Each one is breakable, collectable, and placeable. There are almost no limits to what you can build!

howtoplay.blocks.text.2.text: Most blocks you will have to find in the world, but some can only be crafted such as combining other blocks on a crafting table like a Redstone Block or smelted in a furnace like Glass.

howtoplay.blocks.text.3.text: Most blocks are not affected by gravity and can float in mid air, but some like Sand and Gravel, will fall if there is no block underneath them.

howtoplay.blocks.text.4.text: Here are some examples of the more interesting blocks in Minecraft:

howtoplay.blocks.text.5.text: §eGlass§f - This is a transparent block that is made by smelting Sand in a Furnace.

howtoplay.blocks.text.6.text: §eConcrete§f - This is made by dropping a Concrete Powder block into water.

howtoplay.blocks.text.7.text: §eTerracotta§f - This is found naturally in Badlands biomes or can be crafted and dyed from Clay that is found underwater. Terracotta can be made into Glazed Terracotta by smelting it in a Furnace.

howtoplay.blocks.text.8.text: §eMagma Block§f - This is found naturally in the Nether, it gives off a little light and will burn whoever steps on it.

howtoplay.blocks.text.9.text: §eCoarse Dirt§f - This is almost like a normal Dirt Block but Grass can't grow on it. It can be found in Savanna and Mega Taiga biomes.

howtoplay.bookAndQuill.text.1.text: The Book and Quill lets you record your adventures. Tell your story by entering text into the pages. You can even change the title and the author! Sign the Book and Quill to finalize your work. The Book and Quill will be editable until it is signed.

howtoplay.brewingStand.text.1.text: Brewing potions requires a Brewing Stand. Every potion starts off with a bottle of water, which is made by filling a Glass Bottle with water from a Cauldron or water source.

howtoplay.brewingStand.text.2.text: A Brewing Stand has three slots for creating different potions. One ingredient can be used over all three bottles, so always brew three potions at the same time to best use your resources.

howtoplay.brewingStand.text.3.text: Putting Nether Wart in the top position of the Brewing Stand will give you an Awkward Potion. This doesn't have any effect by itself, but creates a base potion that can be used to create more advanced potions.

howtoplay.brewingStand.text.4.text: There are many potion effects to discover, experiment with different ingredients and combinations to become a true alchemist.

howtoplay.buildingAShelter.text.1.text: When danger comes lurking, a sturdy §eshelter§f can protect you from the threats outside.

howtoplay.buildingAShelter.text.2.text: Building a shelter is critical to surviving your first night, and it doesn't have to be hard.

howtoplay.buildingAShelter.text.3.text: You can build one with anything from dirt to stone, or even close up a cave for a makeshift lodging!

howtoplay.buildingAShelter.title.text: How to Play: Building a Shelter

howtoplay.camera.text.1.text: The Camera allows players to take pictures in the world.

howtoplay.camera.text.2.text: To take a picture from your point of view, press :_input_key.use:.

howtoplay.camera.text.2.touch.text: To take a picture from your point of view, tap and hold, then release.

howtoplay.camera.text.3.text: To take a selfie, place a camera and press :_input_key.use: on it.

howtoplay.camera.text.3.touch.text: To take a selfie, place a camera and tap the Take Picture button.

howtoplay.camera.text.4.text: Pictures can be viewed in the Portfolio or inserted into the Book and Quill.

howtoplay.category.overworld.comment: Meaning: Everything Overworld in alphabetical order

howtoplay.cauldron.text.1.text: The Cauldron is a container that can hold buckets or bottles of liquid.

howtoplay.cauldron.text.2.notTouch.text: Press :_input_key.use: on a Cauldron while holding a Bucket of Water or a Potion to fill the Cauldron with its contents.

howtoplay.cauldron.text.2.touch.text: Tap a Cauldron while holding a Bucket of Water or a Potion to fill the Cauldron with its contents.

howtoplay.cauldron.text.3.text: A Potion will only partially fill a Cauldron so you will have to use multiple Potions to fill it up completely.

howtoplay.cauldron.text.4.notTouch.text: Press :_input_key.use: on a Cauldron with your Arrow in hand to create all kinds of different arrows!

howtoplay.cauldron.text.4.touch.text: Tap a Cauldron with your Arrow in hand to create all kinds of different arrows!

howtoplay.cauldron.text.5.notTouch.text: To dye Leather Armor or Leather Horse Armor, press :_input_key.use: on a Cauldron filled with water while holding the desired dye. This will change the color of the water inside of the Cauldron. Then dip your armor into the Cauldron by pressing :_input_key.use: with armor in your hand.

howtoplay.cauldron.text.5.touch.text: To dye Leather Armor or Leather Horse Armor, tap a Cauldron filled with water while holding the desired dye. This will change the color of the water inside of the Cauldron. Then dip your armor into the Cauldron by tapping the Cauldron with the armor in your hand.

howtoplay.cauldron.text.6.text: If you want to wash the dye off, dip the dyed item into a Cauldron of undyed Water.

howtoplay.chalkboard.text.1.text: Chalkboards are used to display text in the world. Chalkboards display more text than Signs, can be edited after they have been placed, and come in three sizes: Slate, Poster, and Board. The lock toggle allows you to prevent non-World Builders from destroying or editing your chalkboards. Press :_input_key.use: on an existing chalkboard to edit it.

howtoplay.chalkboard.text.1.touch.text: Chalkboards are used to display text in the world. Chalkboards display more text than Signs, can be edited after they have been placed, and come in three sizes: Slate, Poster, and Board. The lock toggle allows you to prevent non-World Builders from destroying or editing your chalkboards. Tap an existing chalkboard to edit it.

howtoplay.chat.text.1.gamepad.text: Press :_input_key.chat: to open Chat. Type your message and press the send button.

howtoplay.chat.text.1.keyboard.text: Press :_input_key.chat: to open Chat. Type your message and press ENTER.

howtoplay.chat.text.1.touch.text: Tap the chat button to open Chat. Type your message and tap the send button.

howtoplay.chemistry.text.1.text: Students can simulate real world chemistry by using the Chemistry Equipment blocks. Build any of the 118 different elements by adjusting the sliders in the Element Constructor or view the composition of elements by placing them in the Element Constructor. Combine elements in the Compound Creator to produce chemical compounds. Put elements and compounds into the Lab Table to create Minecraft items. Reduce blocks to their component elements with the Material Reducer.

howtoplay.chemistry.text.2.text: Download the Chemistry Journal from the Minecraft Education website for a comprehensive guide to chemistry in Minecraft.

howtoplay.chests.text.1.notTouch.text: Once you have crafted a Chest, you can place it in the world and then open it with :_input_key.use: to store items from your inventory.

howtoplay.chests.text.1.touch.text: Once you have crafted a Chest, you can place it in the world and then tap to open it and store items from your inventory.

howtoplay.chests.text.2.text: Items in the Chest will be stored there for you to put into your inventory later.

howtoplay.chests.text.3.text: Two Chests placed next to each other will be combined to form a Large Chest.

howtoplay.classroomMode.text.1.text: Classroom Mode is an external application that provides educators with features designed to facilitate interaction with students. You can download Classroom Mode from the Minecraft Education website.

howtoplay.classroomMode.text.2.text: As the host of a world, use the command /classroommode to launch the Classroom Mode app and connect it to Minecraft Education.

howtoplay.codeBuilder.text.1.text: Code Builder allows players to explore, create, and play in Minecraft by writing code using familiar learn-to-code platforms.

howtoplay.codeBuilder.text.2.text: Launch Code Builder by pressing :_input_key.codeBuilder: or by using the command /code.

howtoplay.codeBuilder.text.2.touch.text: Launch Code Builder by tapping :code_builder_button: or by using the command /code.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.1.text: Command Blocks are a powerful tool for map creators. They store and execute commands upon receiving a Redstone signal.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.2.text: To get a command block you must use /give.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.3.text: When a Command Block has either executed or failed to execute its stored command, it sends a Redstone signal from the side where the arrow is pointing.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.4.text: You can set the name of the Command Block in the Hover Note field.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.5.text: §eBlock Type§f - There are three types of Command Blocks, each with their own color and behavior:

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.5.1.text: §eImpulse§f - Only executes the stored command when the block receives a redstone signal.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.5.2.text: §eChain§f - Executes the stored command when the Command Block behind it has or has not executed its command.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.5.3.text: §eRepeat§f - Once activated, this Command Block will continue executing its stored command as long as it exists.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.6.text: §eCondition§f - There are two conditions, each will affect the behavior of the Command Block:

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.6.1.text: §eUnconditional§f - Executes the stored command even if the Command Block behind it failed to execute its command.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.6.2.text: §eConditional§f - Only executes the stored command if the Command Block behind it succeeded in executing its command.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.7.text: §eRedstone§f - There are two redstone settings, each will affect the behavior of the Command Block:

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.7.1.text: §eNeeds Redstone§f - Requires a redstone signal to activate.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.7.2.text: §eAlways Active§f - Does not require a redstone signal to activate.

howtoplay.commandBlocks.text.8.text: A Command Block will also show you its previous output. This will help you figure out if a Command Block failed to execute its command and why.

howtoplay.commands.text.1.text: Commands can be executed from Chat. Type / before you type the command.

howtoplay.commands.text.2.text: There are multitudes of commands that will allow you to do amazing things. There are many sources out there that will provide you with all of the info that you'll ever need.

howtoplay.conduits.text.1.text: An active Conduit gives you powers when you are underwater and when it rains.

howtoplay.conduits.text.2.text: A Conduit is crafted with Nautilus Shells and a Heart of the Sea. The Conduit draws power from Prismarine and Sea Lanterns.

howtoplay.conduits.text.3.text: Once activated, a Conduit will grant Conduit Power to anything nearby.

howtoplay.conduits.text.4.text: The more power it draws in, the further its abilities reach.

howtoplay.craftingATool.text.1.text: §eTools§f help you get things done faster. Some, like the §epickaxe§f:wood_pickaxe: , let you mine stone and various ores. Others, like the §esword§f:wood_sword: , help you keep enemies at bay.

howtoplay.craftingATool.text.2.gamepad.text: To craft a tool, open up your §ecrafting table§f:crafting_table: by walking up to it and pressing :_input_key.use:. You can craft a basic version of most tools using two sticks and a few planks - your §erecipe book§f will tell you how!

howtoplay.craftingATool.text.2.keyboard.text: To craft a tool, open up your §ecrafting table§f:crafting_table: by walking up to it and right-clicking it. You can craft a basic version of most tools using two sticks and a few planks - your §erecipe book§f will tell you how!

howtoplay.craftingATool.text.2.touch.text: To craft a tool, open up your §ecrafting table§f:crafting_table: by walking up to it and tapping it. You can craft a basic version of most tools using two sticks and a few planks - your §erecipe book§f will tell you how!

howtoplay.craftingATool.title.text: How to Play: Crafting a Tool

howtoplay.craftingTable.text.1.text: The Crafting Table will let you craft more complicated recipes.

howtoplay.craftingTable.text.2.notTouch.text: Place it in the world, then press :_input_key.use: on the Crafting Table to use it.

howtoplay.craftingTable.text.2.touch.text: Place it in the world, then tap the Crafting Table to use it.

howtoplay.creativeMode.text.1.text: Creative Mode is there so you can build the land of your dreams mob free!

howtoplay.creativeMode.text.2.text: The creative mode interface allows any item in the game to be moved into the player's inventory without the need for mining or crafting the item. The items in the player's inventory will not be removed when they are placed or used in the world, and this allows the player to focus on building rather than resource gathering.

howtoplay.creativeMode.text.3.text: If you create, load, or save a world in Creative Mode, that world will have achievements and leaderboard updates disabled, even if it is then loaded in Survival Mode.

howtoplay.creativeMode.text.4.gamepad.text: To fly when in Creative Mode, press :_input_key.jump: twice quickly. To exit flying, repeat the action. To fly faster, push :_gamepad_stick_left: forward twice in rapid succession while flying. When in flying mode, you can hold down :_input_key.jump: to move up and :_input_key.sneak: to move down.

howtoplay.creativeMode.text.4.keyboard.text: To fly when in Creative Mode, press :_input_key.jump: twice quickly. To exit flying, repeat the action. To fly faster, push :_input_key.forward: twice in rapid succession or press :_input_key.sprint: while flying. When in flying mode, you can hold down :_input_key.jump: to move up and :_input_key.sneak: to move down.

howtoplay.creativeMode.text.4a.touch.cla.text: To fly tap :touch_jump: twice quickly, and to stop flying tap :touch_stop_flying: twice quickly.

howtoplay.creativeMode.text.4a.touch.joy.text: To fly tap :tip_virtual_button_jump: twice quickly, and to stop flying tap :tip_virtual_button_fly_down: twice quickly.

howtoplay.creativeMode.text.4b.touch.cla.text: Tap :touch_forward: twice quickly to fly faster. To fly up tap and hold :touch_fly_up:, and to fly down tap and hold :touch_fly_down:.

howtoplay.creativeMode.text.4b.touch.joy.text: Tap :tip_virtual_button_sprint: to fly faster. To fly up tap and hold :tip_virtual_button_fly_up:, and to fly down tap and hold :tip_virtual_button_fly_down:.

howtoplay.deathAndRespawn.text.1.text: Enemies appear every night, and even the best of us can be caught off guard. If your §ehealth bar§f:heart: runs out, you'll die - and then respawn right where you started!

howtoplay.deathAndRespawn.text.2.text: You have unlimited lives, but you drop all items in your inventory when you die. If you're quick enough, you can pick your items back up right where you dropped them.

howtoplay.deathAndRespawn.title.text: How to Play: Death and Respawn

howtoplay.difficulty.text.1.text: Minecraft has varying levels of difficulty so you can tailor the game to your level.

howtoplay.difficulty.text.2.text: No hostile mobs will spawn except for shulkers and the Ender Dragon, but they won't do any damage to you.

howtoplay.difficulty.text.3.text: Hostile mobs spawn but deal less damage. Hunger bar depletes and drains health down to 5 hearts.

howtoplay.difficulty.text.4.text: Hostile mobs will do normal damage, and if your hunger level drops to zero your health will begin to drop, but you won't die.

howtoplay.difficulty.text.5.text: Hostile mobs will do more damage, zombies will break through doors, and if your hunger level drops to zero, your health will drop and you could die.

howtoplay.dispensers.text.1.text: Dispensers are used to shoot out items. You will need to power each Dispenser with a redstone signal (for example, with a lever) to trigger it.

howtoplay.dispensers.text.2.notTouch.text: To fill a Dispenser with items, press :_input_key.use: on the Dispenser, then move the items that you want to dispense from your inventory to the Dispenser.

howtoplay.dispensers.text.2.touch.text: To fill a Dispenser, tap the Dispenser, then move the items that you want to dispense from your inventory into the Dispenser.

howtoplay.dispensers.text.3.text: Whenever you power a Dispenser, an item will shoot out.

howtoplay.dispensers.text.4.text: Dispensers can also be used to place items as well, such as Pumpkins on Iron Golems and equipment on Armor Stands.

howtoplay.droppers.text.1.notTouch.text: When powered by Redstone, Droppers will drop a single random item contained within. Press :_input_key.use: on the Dropper to open it and then you can load it with items from your inventory.

howtoplay.droppers.text.1.touch.text: When powered by Redstone, Droppers will drop a single random item contained within. Tap the Dropper to open it and then you can load it with items from your inventory.

howtoplay.droppers.text.2.text: If a Dropper is facing a Chest or another type of container, the item will be placed into that instead. Long chains of Droppers can be constructed to transport items over a distance.

howtoplay.dyes.text.1.text: Dye is used to change the color of many things in Minecraft.

howtoplay.dyes.text.2.text: Some Dye materials are harder to find than others. Most Dyes can be crafted from flowers, like §eRed Dye§f from a Poppy, but some Dyes are found or created in more obscure ways such as:

howtoplay.dyes.text.3.text: §eBlue Dye§f - Mining Lapis Lazuli deep underground

howtoplay.dyes.text.4.text: §eBlack Dye§f - Collecting Ink Sacs from Squids

howtoplay.dyes.text.5.text: §eBrown Dye§f - Harvesting Cocoa Beans in the Jungle

howtoplay.elytra.text.1.text: Elytra are an item that can be equipped to allow gliding. Elytra are equipped in the chest armor slot.

howtoplay.elytra.text.2.text: Elytra cannot be crafted, but are found in Item Frames in rare End Ships, guarded by fearsome Shulkers.

howtoplay.elytra.text.3.notTouch.text: When equipped with Elytra, a player can press :_input_key.jump: while falling to start gliding. Note that you need to be quite high to really get the full effect!

howtoplay.elytra.text.3.touch.text: When equipped with Elytra, tap :touch_jump: or :tip_virtual_button_fly_up: while falling to start gliding. Make sure you're high up to get the full effect!

howtoplay.elytra.text.4.text: While gliding, you can steer by looking around. If you look downwards, you'll move faster - but you'll also hit the ground sooner. If you look upwards, you'll gain some height - but do it for too long and you'll stall, falling instead of rising!

howtoplay.elytra.text.4.touch.text: You can steer while gliding by looking around. If you look downwards, you'll gain some speed, but you'll also hit the ground faster. If you look upward, you'll gain some height, but do it for too long and you'll stall - which means you'll start falling.

howtoplay.elytra.text.5.text: Your Elytra will slowly lose durability while flying, and if they break mid-flight you'll fall. You can repair them by combining them with Phantom Membrane at an Anvil.

howtoplay.elytra.text.6.text: Firework Rockets that have no effects can be used to extend Elytra flight. You will be damaged if you use a Firework Rocket that has effects to extend flight.

howtoplay.enchantingTable.text.1.text: The Experience Points collected by picking up Experience Orbs can be used to enchant Weapons, Armor, Tools, and Books.

howtoplay.enchantingTable.text.2.text: When an enchantable item is placed in the slot below the book in the Enchantment Table, the three buttons to the right of the slot will display some enchantments with their Experience Level cost and Lapis Lazuli cost.

howtoplay.enchantingTable.text.3.text: The actual enchantment applied is randomly selected based on the cost displayed.

howtoplay.enchantingTable.text.4.text: If the Enchantment Table is surrounded by Bookshelves (up to a maximum of 15), with a one block gap between the Bookshelf and the Enchantment Table, arcane glyphs will be seen going to the book on the Enchantment Table and the potency of the enchantments will be increased.

howtoplay.enchantingTable.text.5.text: Enchanted Books are used at the Anvil to apply enchantments to items. This gives you more control over which enchantments you would like on your items.

howtoplay.endCities.text.1.text: After killing the Ender Dragon, an End Gateway will appear. Throwing an Ender Pearl into the portal will teleport you to the outer islands.

howtoplay.endCities.text.2.text: This alien new landscape must hide something interesting, and maybe something to bring back with you.

howtoplay.enderChest.text.1.text: All Ender Chests in a world are linked. Items placed into an Ender Chest are accessible in any other Ender Chest. However, the contents of the Ender Chests are specific for each player. This allows players to store items in any Ender Chest, and retrieve them from other Ender Chests in different positions in the world.

howtoplay.eyeOfEnder.text.1.text: Eyes of Ender are mysteriously connected to the End and will behave strangely when used.

howtoplay.eyeOfEnder.text.2.text: Rumor has it that they can lead you to open another dimension.

howtoplay.farming.text.1.text: There are a variety of different crops that you can farm in Minecraft. Farming, while challenging, can provide an infinite food source.

howtoplay.farming.text.2.text: Crops require light, water, and farmland to grow. You need a hoe, a water source, and seeds to farm.

howtoplay.farming.text.3.text: The Blocks next to the water need to be converted to farmland, do this with the hoe. Water will saturate up to four block away.

howtoplay.farming.text.4.text: Now you can plant your seeds. Make sure your crops are protected as they can easily die from being trampled or lack of water or light.

howtoplay.farming.text.5.text: Fences can help protect your crops from hungry rabbits or trampling toes!

howtoplay.farming.text.6.text: When the crops are fully grown they change in appearance and can be harvested.

howtoplay.farming.text.7.text: Some plants like pumpkins and melons grow on stalks. Be careful not to harvest the stalks!

howtoplay.fireworks.text.1.text: Fireworks are a fun way to create your own unique celebration in Minecraft!

howtoplay.fireworks.text.2.text: Fireworks have two components, the Firework Rocket and the Firework Star.

howtoplay.fireworks.text.3.notTouch.text: To use a Firework, press :_input_key.use: on a block to send the Firework shooting into the sky.

howtoplay.fireworks.text.3.touch.text: To use a Firework, tap on a block to send the Firework shooting into the sky.

howtoplay.fireworks.text.4.text: Fireworks have no effect other than shooting up into the air.

howtoplay.fireworks.text.5.text: Firework Stars can be added to during the crafting of the Firework Rocket to give it many different colors and effects.

howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.text: Firework Stars are made from gunpowder and various other items:

howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.1.text: §eColor§f - Adding dye of any color will make an explosion of that color.

howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.2.text: §eTwinkle§f - Adding Glowstone Dust will make the explosion twinkle.

howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.3.text: §eCreeper Shaped§f - Adding a Head will make a creeper pattern in the sky.

howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.4.text: §eBurst§f - Adding a feather will give the explosion a burst effect.

howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.5.text: §eTrail§f - Adding a Diamond will give the explosion trails.

howtoplay.fireworks.text.6.6.text: §eStar Shaped§f - Adding a Gold Nugget will make a star pattern in the sky.

howtoplay.fireworks.text.7.text: Fireworks can be fired from a dispenser. This will shoot the Firework in the direction that the dispenser is facing.

howtoplay.fishing.text.1.text: Fishing must be done with a Fishing Rod and is an excellent way to catch some fish or other cool items from the sea!

howtoplay.fishing.text.2.notTouch.text: Aim at a block of water and press :_input_key.use: while holding a fishing rod to cast the lure into the water.

howtoplay.fishing.text.2.touch.text: Look at a block of water and tap the Fish button while holding a Fishing Rod to cast the lure into the water.

howtoplay.fishing.text.3.text: Wait until you start to see a trail of bubbles coming for the lure.

howtoplay.fishing.text.4.notTouch.text: When the bubbles touch the lure, it will bob up and down. Press :_input_key.use: to reel in the lure. Be careful not to let your fish get away!

howtoplay.fishing.text.4.touch.text: When the bubbles touch the lure, it will bob up and down. Tap the Fish button again to reel in the lure. Be careful not to let your fish get away!

howtoplay.food.text.1.text: You'll slowly get hungry during your adventures - fortunately the Overworld is full of food! You can gather apples from trees, meat from animals, or why not grow your own crops using a hoe?

howtoplay.food.text.2.gamepad.text: To eat a food, select it in your hotbar, then press and hold :_input_key.use:. Keep the §ehunger bar§f:shank: full to regain health when you take damage.

howtoplay.food.text.2.keyboard.text: To eat a food, select it in your hotbar, then click and hold the right mouse button. Keep the §ehunger bar§f:shank: full to regain health when you take damage.

howtoplay.food.text.2.touch.text: To eat a food, select it in your hotbar, then tap the screen and hold. Keep the §ehunger bar§f:shank: full to regain health when you take damage.

howtoplay.food.text.3.text: Some raw foods are better when cooked first on a campfire or in a furnace - your tummy will thank you!

howtoplay.furnace.text.1.text: A Furnace allows you to cook or smelt items. For example, you can smelt Iron Ore into Iron Ingots.

howtoplay.furnace.text.2.notTouch.text: Place the Furnace in the world and press :_input_key.use: to use it.

howtoplay.furnace.text.2.touch.text: Place the Furnace in the world and tap to use it.

howtoplay.furnace.text.3.text: You need to put some fuel into the bottom of the Furnace, and the item that you want smelted in the top. The Furnace will then fire up and start working. Lots of things can be used as fuel; try experimenting with anything burnable!

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.1.text: When creating a world, you have many options. Below are the various settings that can be used to fine tune your experience. Don't worry if you didn't set them when you created the world, they can be changed at any time.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.10.text: Below are gamerules, cheats must be turned on to use them:

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.11.text: §eAlways Day§f: Night will never fall when this setting is turned on.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.12.text: §eDo Daylight Cycle§f: The time will not advance when this setting is turned off.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.13.text: §eKeep Inventory§f: This setting allows players to keep their inventory when they die.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.14.text: §eMob Spawning§f: This prevents all mobs from spawning when this setting is off.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.15.text: §eMob Griefing§f: Prevents mobs from destroying the world.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.16.text: §eEntities Drop Loot§f: Controls whether things like minecarts and armor stands will drop themselves when they are broken.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.17.text: §eWeather Cycle§f: The weather will not change when this setting is turned off.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.2.text: §eWorld Name§f: This is where you can name your world.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.3.text: §eDefault Game Mode§f: This is the gamemode that all new players to the world will start with. You can have players start in either survival or creative mode. Selecting creative mode will turn cheats on.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.4.text: §eDifficulty§f: This setting affects how difficult the world will be. You can choose Peaceful, Easy, Normal, or Hard.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.5.text: §eStarting Map§f: If this setting is turned on, every player will start with a map in their hotbar.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.6.text: §eBonus Chest§f: If this setting is turned on, there will be a chest with some starting loot near your initial spawn location.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.7.text: §eWorld Type§f: This setting controls the way the world is created. Select Infinite or Flat from the drop down menu to change the world type.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.7.1.text: §eInfinite worlds§f go on and on forever.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.7.2.text: §eFlat worlds§f do not have any hills or trees, just an infinite flat area to fill with your creations.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.8.text: §eSeed§f: This is a unique number for the world. By entering a seed when you make a new world, you can control how it is created. You can also use a word or phrase for the seed and the game will convert it to a number for you.

howtoplay.gameSettings.text.9.text: §eActivate Cheats§f: This setting allows players to use commands. When a world is created with this setting on, all achievements are disabled.

howtoplay.gatheringResources.text.1.text: The world is full of resources, including §ebuilding blocks§f, §ecrafting materials§f, and §efood§f.

howtoplay.gatheringResources.text.2.nott.text: You can §ebreak blocks§f with your bare hands to gather resources like dirt and wood. Aim at a block, then §epress and hold§f :_input_key.attack:  until it breaks and the resources drop.

howtoplay.gatheringResources.text.2.pc.text: You can §ebreak blocks§f with your bare hands to gather resources like dirt and wood. Aim at a block, then §eclick and hold§f :_input_key.attack:  until it breaks and the resources drop.

howtoplay.gatheringResources.text.2.touc.text: You can §ebreak blocks§f with your bare hands to gather resources like dirt and wood. §eTouch and hold§f on the block until it breaks and the resources drop.

You can §ebreak blocks§f with your bare hands to gather resources like dirt and wood. Aim at a block, then §etouch and hold§f :tip_virtual_button_action_attack_or_destroy:  until it breaks and the resources drop.

howtoplay.gatheringResources.text.3.text: Pick up any dropped resources by walking over the floating icons.

howtoplay.hoppers.text.1.text: Hoppers are used to automatically move items. Hoppers can be attached to some other items like containers such as Chests or Jukeboxes.

howtoplay.hoppers.text.2.text: Hoppers will continuously remove items out of a container placed above them and move them into the container they are pointing to.

howtoplay.hoppers.text.3.text: To make a Hopper point to a particular block, place the Hopper against that block while sneaking.

howtoplay.hoppers.text.4.text: If a Hopper is powered by Redstone, it will become inactive and stop moving items.

howtoplay.hostAndPlayerOptions.text.1.no.text: When playing with cheats on, host options will allow you to teleport yourself or friends, change the weather, set the time of day, and change the entry point or world spawn of your game. Once cheats have been enabled, you can find these options in the chat window by pressing the [/] button next to the chat bar.

howtoplay.hostAndPlayerOptions.text.1.to.text: When playing with cheats on, host options will allow you to teleport yourself or friends, change the weather, set the time of day, and change the entry point or world spawn of your game. Once cheats have been enabled, you can find these options in the chat window by tapping the chat button.

howtoplay.improvedTools.text.1.text: Use your tools a lot and they'll eventually break. As you gather new materials, such as stone, you'll be able to craft better tools.

howtoplay.improvedTools.text.2.text: Tools of higher tiers are more durable, more efficient, and able to gather more valuable resources. Go out into the world and find out for yourself!

howtoplay.inventory.text.1.pc_console.text: Your hotbar will fill up as you gather more resources. Press :_input_key.inventory: to access your §einventory§f, where you'll have more space for everything you've collected.

howtoplay.inventory.text.1.rift.text: Your hotbar will fill up as you gather more resources. Press :rift_B: to access your §einventory§f, where you'll have more space for everything you've collected.

howtoplay.inventory.text.1.touch.text: Your hotbar will fill up as you gather more resources. Tap :tip_touch_inventory: to access your §einventory§f, where you'll have more space for everything you've collected.

howtoplay.inventory.text.1.windowsmr.text: Your hotbar will fill up as you gather more resources. Press :windowsmr_left_grab: to access your §einventory§f, where you'll have more space for everything you've collected.

howtoplay.inventory.text.2.gamepad.text: Want to move something between your §ehotbar§f and your inventory? Use the cursor to select an item and press :_gamepad_face_button_down:. Then, move your cursor to an empty item slot and press again to drop the item.

howtoplay.inventory.text.2.keyboard.text: Want to move something between your §ehotbar§f and your inventory? Open your inventory, click the item of your choice, then drag it to the empty item slot you'd like to move it to.

howtoplay.inventory.text.2.touch.text: Want to move something between your §ehotbar§f and your inventory? Tap the item of your choice, then tap the empty item slot that you'd like to move it to.

howtoplay.inventory.text.2.vr.text: Want to move something between your §ehotbar§f and your inventory? Use the cursor to select an item and press :_input_key.use:. Then, move your cursor to an empty item slot and press again to drop the item.

howtoplay.jigsawBlocks.text.1.text: Jigsaw Blocks give creators the ability to generate large structures in the world by connecting multiple structure templates.

howtoplay.jigsawBlocks.text.2.text: To get a Jigsaw Block you must use the /give slash command. To use a Jigsaw Block, you must have Operator permissions.

howtoplay.jigsawBlocks.text.3.text: Jigsaw Blocks have multiple settings that control how they join together to form a larger structure.

howtoplay.jigsawBlocks.text.4.text: §eTarget Pool§f - The path of the template pool to search for a connecting structure template. The template pool should contain at least one structure that matches the Jigsaw's "Target Name" field.

howtoplay.jigsawBlocks.text.5.text: §eName§f - The name of the Jigsaw. This is used when connecting from Jigsaws with a matching "Target Name".

howtoplay.jigsawBlocks.text.6.text: §eTurns Into§f - The type of block the Jigsaw Block will turn into when placed in the world during structure generation.

howtoplay.jigsawBlocks.text.7.text: §eSelection Priority§f - When the parent piece is being processed for connections, this is the order in which this Jigsaw block attempts to connect to its target piece. Jigsaws will be processed in descending priority with random ordering breaking ties.

howtoplay.jigsawBlocks.text.8.text: §ePlacement Priority§f - When this Jigsaw block connects to a piece, this is the order in which that piece is processed for connections in the wider structure. Pieces will be processed in descending priority with insertion order breaking ties.

howtoplay.jigsawBlocks.text.9.text: §eJoint Type§f - A joint can be either Rollable (default) or Aligned. If the joint type is Rollable, the target structure will be rotated randomly around the source Jigsaw Block. If the joint type is Aligned, the target structure will be placed such that the rotation of the target Jigsaw Block aligns with the rotation of the source Jigsaw Block. Note that this only applies when the Jigsaw Block is placed facing up or down.

howtoplay.jukebox.text.1.text: The Jukebox will play Music Discs that you have found.

howtoplay.jukebox.text.2.notTouch.text: Press :_input_key.use: on a Jukebox with a Music Disc in your hand to play it. Press :_input_key.use: the Jukebox again to eject the Music Disc.

howtoplay.jukebox.text.2.touch.text: Tap a Jukebox with a Music Disc in your hand to play it. Tap the Jukebox again to eject the Music Disc.

howtoplay.jukebox.text.3.text: When a Jukebox is playing a Music Disc, it will power Redstone Dust.

howtoplay.jukebox.text.4.text: Try different Music Discs for a different power level.

howtoplay.jukebox.text.5.text: See what happens when you let it play to the end.

howtoplay.jukebox.text.6.text: A Hopper can put a Music Disc in for you, and take it out when it's done playing.

howtoplay.jukebox.text.7.text: There are a couple of Music Discs that can be found in Chests around the world.

howtoplay.jukebox.text.8.text: Others are more difficult to come by, Creepers secretly appreciate music.

howtoplay.loom.text.1.text: The Loom is a fast and efficient way to apply patterns to Banners. The Loom only uses one Dye to apply a pattern. It can also use Loom patterns to apply special patterns.

howtoplay.loom.text.2.text: By placing a Banner into the Loom's first slot, and any color dye into the second slot, patterns can be added to the Banner. Once a pattern is selected, take it from the output slot on the right and move it to your inventory.

howtoplay.loom.text.3.text: A Banner can have multiple layers allowing you to experiment with many different banner possibilities. Up to 6 patterns can be applied to a Banner to create a unique design.

howtoplay.loom.text.4.text: Adding a Loom Pattern to the Loom's third slot will allow the crafting of special patterns like a creeper face or a flower pattern. You will not lose your Loom Patterns when you apply these patterns to your Banners.

howtoplay.mashups.text.1.text: Explore thrilling themed worlds, parceled up with matching skins, textures and more!

howtoplay.minecoins.text.1.text: Explore a world of possibility with Minecoins: Minecraft's in-game currency! Minecoins let you add variety to your gameplat across supported Minecraft games.

howtoplay.minecoins.text.2.text: Once redeemed, your Minecoins are linked to your Microsoft account, so you can access your coins and purchases on other supported devices, too!

howtoplay.minecoins.text.3.text: *Minecoins require a version of Minecraft: Bedrock Edition with Minecraft Marketplace. Minecoins are not compatible on PlayStation®. For compatibility information see minecraft.net/minecoins

howtoplay.mining.text.1.text: Not all crafting materials are on the surface - some may require you to dig underground or into a mountain.

howtoplay.mining.text.2.text: A §epickaxe§f:wood_pickaxe: helps you uncover all sorts of materials, such as stone, coal, iron, and precious ore - though you may need extra sturdy tools for some rarer materials!

howtoplay.mining.text.3.text: Some raw metals will need to be smelted using a §efurnace§f:furnace: . Place a fuel like coal or wood logs in the fuel slot, then add raw ore to smelt it into something useful.

howtoplay.mounts.text.1.text: A player can ride any adult §eHorse§f, §eDonkey§f, §eMule§f, or §eCamel§f. Only Horses can be armored.

howtoplay.mounts.text.10.text: Llamas can be tamed the same as horses. However, even when tamed, the player can't control their movements when riding them.

howtoplay.mounts.text.11.text: A lead can be attached to one, and when this happens, surrounding llamas (both tamed and un-tamed) will follow, making a caravan.

howtoplay.mounts.text.12.text: Llamas can be equipped with chests, giving it 3-15 slots of inventory space depending on the strength of the Llama. They can also be equipped with carpets. Each carpet color yields a different pattern.

howtoplay.mounts.text.13.text: Pigs can be ridden as well, although they won't go where you want without a little incentive.

howtoplay.mounts.text.14.text: Equip a pig with a Saddle and point a Carrot on a Stick in the direction you want to go.

howtoplay.mounts.text.15a.touch.text: When using the D-Pad control scheme, tap :touch_jump: to dismount an animal.

howtoplay.mounts.text.15b.touch.text: When using a Joystick control scheme, tap :tip_virtual_button_dismount: to dismount an animal.

howtoplay.mounts.text.2.text: Mules and Donkeys may be equipped with saddlebags (for transporting items) by attaching a Chest. These saddlebags can then be accessed whilst riding or sneaking.

howtoplay.mounts.text.3.notTouch.text: Horses, Donkeys, and Mules must be §etamed§f before they can be used. A player can tame a horse by riding it and staying on while it tries to buck them off. Press :_input_key.use: with an empty hand to attempt to tame Horses, Donkeys, and Mules.

howtoplay.mounts.text.3.touch.text: Horses, Donkeys, and Mules must be §etamed§f before they can be used. A player can tame a horse by riding it and staying on while it tries to buck them off. Tap the Mount button that appears when near a horse  to attempt to tame Horses, Donkeys, and Mules.

howtoplay.mounts.text.4.text: When Hearts appear around the horse, it has been tamed and will no longer attempt to throw the player off.

howtoplay.mounts.text.5.text: To steer horses and camels, the player must equip it with a §eSaddle§f.

howtoplay.mounts.text.6.text: Saddles can be bought from villagers, found inside Chests hidden in the world, or acquired by fishing. While riding a horse, open your inventory and put a saddle in the horse's saddle slot.

howtoplay.mounts.text.6b.text: A camel can carry two players at the same time.

howtoplay.mounts.text.7.text: Horses and Donkeys can be bred like other animals using Golden Apples or Golden Carrots.

howtoplay.mounts.text.8.text: Foals will grow into adult horses over time, although feeding them Wheat or Hay will speed this up.

howtoplay.mounts.text.9.text: Llamas are another ridable mob which can be tamed and used to transport large shipments of items.

howtoplay.movingAround.text.1.text: Welcome to the Overworld, a blocky world full of adventure and possibility!

howtoplay.movingAround.text.2.touch.text: Look around by touching and dragging the screen.

howtoplay.movingAround.text.3.touch.joys.text: Move around the world using the on-screen joystick:tip_virtual_joystick: .
Move around the world using the on-screen joystick:tip_virtual_joystick: .

howtoplay.movingAround.text.3a.touch.cla.text: Move around the world using the on-screen buttons.

howtoplay.navigation.text.1.text: Navigation is an important skill that you will learn in Minecraft as it's not always easy to find your way home.

howtoplay.navigation.text.10.text: There are several places for you to explore. Find a village and look for a Cartographer. He will trade you Explorer Maps that will lead you to strange places very far away.

howtoplay.navigation.text.2.text: First of all, there are some basic tools that you should know about.

howtoplay.navigation.text.3.text: A Compass will point in the direction of the first place you spawned into the world, an easy way to find where you started.

howtoplay.navigation.text.4.text: A Map lets you see the area you've explored. Put it in your offhand slot to use it like a mini-map. You can increase its size by adding more paper to the edges in a Crafting Table.

howtoplay.navigation.text.5.text: A Locator Map will show you where you are and what direction you are facing in relation to the Locator Map's origin. It will also show you the location of other players in the same world.

howtoplay.navigation.text.6.text: A Cartography Table can help you create, expand, copy and even name maps.

howtoplay.navigation.text.7.text: Place paper into the first slot to craft a Map. If you add a compass into the second slot you can craft a Locator Map. Adding Paper or a blank Map will let you expand or copy your Map.

howtoplay.navigation.text.8.text: Try to watch for landmarks as you explore. The more you play on a world, the more you will be able to remember where you are. Another good trick is to place Torches as you go so that you may find your way back home.

howtoplay.navigation.text.9.text: The sun can also tell you what direction you are facing. Remember: the sun rises in the east and sets in the west!

howtoplay.netherPortals.text.1.text: A Nether Portal allows you to travel to a different dimension.

howtoplay.netherPortals.text.2.text: If constructed correctly the Nether Portal can be lit and activated.

howtoplay.netherPortals.text.3.text: Example of a portal construction shown here:

howtoplay.nightfall.new.text.1.text: When the sun starts to set, it's time to get ready.

howtoplay.nightfall.new.text.2.text: At night, the Overworld is home to zombies, spiders, skeletons, and other dangerous creatures we call §ehostile mobs§f.

howtoplay.nightfall.new.text.3.text: Crafting some §etorches§f can help you see in the dark, while also keeping mobs from spawning too close.

howtoplay.nightfall.new.text.4.gamepad.text: While holding a torch, place it into the world by pressing :_input_key.use:.

howtoplay.nightfall.new.text.4.keyboard.text: While holding a torch, place it into the world by right-clicking a nearby free surface.

howtoplay.nightfall.new.text.4.touch.text: While holding a torch, place it into the world by tapping a nearby free surface.

howtoplay.nightfall.new.text.4.touch.cro.text: While holding a torch, place it into the world by aiming at a nearby block and tapping :tip_virtual_button_action_build_or_use:.

howtoplay.nightfall.text.1.text: In Minecraft, the sun rises and sets as you adventure in your world. As the sun sets, you must take precautions. There are many dangers at night!

howtoplay.nightfall.text.2.text: If you have not already, you will need a place to take shelter from the dark and what lurks within it. This can be as simple as a hole in the side of a hill or a small cabin in the forest.

howtoplay.nightfall.text.3.text: Be sure to block off all entrances, you may want to use a door so you can go in and out. If you have made a bed this is a good place to put it along with your Crafting Table and Furnace.

howtoplay.nightfall.text.4.text: Also be sure to light up the area with torches, it may save your life.

howtoplay.npc.text.1.text: NPCs are non-player characters that can provide additional lesson information, hints, or instructions.

howtoplay.npc.text.2.text: Only World Builders can place, delete, name, or edit NPCs. NPCs can execute commands and link to websites. Commands can be assigned to buttons in the NPC's dialog window; website links will always have a button.

howtoplay.npc.text.3.text: NPCs have a variety of skins to choose from and are immobile.

howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.1.text: Minecraft Education features several special blocks that make it easier for teachers to create and employ lessons. Only players with World Builder ability can place and destroy these blocks. Only players without World Builder ability are subject to the restrictions imposed by these blocks.

howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.2.text: Allow and Deny blocks control where players can build in a world.

howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.3.text: Players can place or destroy blocks above Allow blocks. Players cannot place or destroy blocks above Deny blocks.

howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.4.text: Allow and Deny blocks do not affect the area below them.

howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.5.text: An Allow block with a Deny block somewhere below it prevents players from building in the space between the two blocks. Above the Allow block, players can place and destroy blocks.

howtoplay.permissionBlocks.text.6.text: Border blocks provide a force field that extends infinitely upward and downward, regardless of the presence of other blocks. Players cannot move through, over, or under a Border block. Players cannot place or destroy blocks that are above or below a Border block.

howtoplay.pets.text.1.notTouch.text: There are several mobs in Minecraft that you can tame and make your pet. Each can be tamed by giving them an item that they like. Once tamed you can have them stay by pressing :_input_key.use: while looking at them.

howtoplay.pets.text.1.touch.text: There are several mobs in Minecraft that you can tame and make your pet. Each can be tamed by giving them an item that they like. Once tamed you can have them stay by tapping the Sit Button.

howtoplay.pets.text.2.text: Wolves are a neutral mob that hunt in the colder climates. They will attack Rabbits, Skeletons, and Sheep but run away from Llamas. They won't attack you unless you provoke them. You can tame them by giving them Bones.

howtoplay.pets.text.3.text: Cats are a neutral mob that can be found in villages. They will attack Rabbits and Baby Turtles. They will also keep Phantoms and Creepers away. They will try to run from you so taming them can be tough. They like fish so give them Raw Cod or Salmon to tame them.

howtoplay.pets.text.4.text: Parrots are a passive mob that live in the Jungle. They will imitate any other mob in the area. Seeds are their favorite, give them a few to tame them. Parrots will also sit on your shoulder... Yes, you can have more than one up there.

howtoplay.placingBlocks.text.1.text: Any block you've picked up can placed back into the world. This way you can build a cozy §eshelter§f or anything else you can imagine!

howtoplay.placingBlocks.text.2.nottouch.text: Choose a block in your hotbar, then press :_input_key.use: to place it.

howtoplay.placingBlocks.text.2.touch.text: Tap a block in your hotbar to select it, then tap somewhere in the world to place it.

howtoplay.placingBlocks.text.2.touch.joy.text: Tap a block in your hotbar to select it, then tap :tip_virtual_button_action_build_or_use: to place it.

howtoplay.placingBlocks.text.3.text: Don't worry if you place something in the wrong spot - simply break it again, then pick it back up!

howtoplay.playingTogether.header.3.text: Realms - The best way to play together

howtoplay.playingTogether.text.1.text: Minecraft is a §emultiplayer§f game by default.

howtoplay.playingTogether.text.10.text: Open the game menu to see a list of players currently in your world, then select the permissions icon to adjust that player's permissions.

howtoplay.playingTogether.text.2.text: Every new world you create starts with multiplayer enabled. If you want to make it §eprivate§f, go to World Settings to turn off multiplayer.

howtoplay.playingTogether.text.3.text: To play with others, go to the §eFriends tab§f to see all available Realms, Friends, and LAN games. Just select any game to join it.

howtoplay.playingTogether.text.4.text: When you start or join an online game, your friends can see this in their Friends tab. If they join, it'll be visible to their friends as well.

howtoplay.playingTogether.text.5.text: You need to be signed in to a §eMicrosoft account§f with an active internet connection to play multiplayer.

howtoplay.playingTogether.text.6.text: It's easy to play with friends using §eRealms§f.

howtoplay.playingTogether.text.7.text: You and up to 10 friends get 24/7 access to a world that's always online. Explore, get creative, or try curated content from Marketplace.

howtoplay.playingTogether.text.8.text: All you need is a paid Realms subscription. Why not try a free 30-day trial?

howtoplay.playingTogether.text.9.text: You decide what people can do in your world by changing §eplayer permissions§f.

howtoplay.portfolio.text.1.text: Pictures you have taken appear in the Portfolio. Press :_input_key.use: to view the Portfolio. When viewing the Portfolio, you can add captions to pictures, delete pictures, and export pictures as a PDF.

howtoplay.portfolio.text.1.touch.text: Pictures you have taken appear in the Portfolio. Tap and hold to view the Portfolio. When viewing the Portfolio, you can add captions to pictures, delete pictures, and export pictures as a PDF.

howtoplay.raids.text.1.text: While exploring the world you may encounter a Pillager encampment or patrol. Pillagers are always looking for villages to raid. Taking their Banners will get their attention, and they may choose to attack a nearby village.

howtoplay.raids.text.2.text: Be sure to defend your village, the attack will stop if you defeat all the raiders.

howtoplay.raids.text.3.text: Villagers will most likely be very grateful that you have saved them from the raiders. Be sure to check back with them, you might get a good deal.

howtoplay.ranching.text.1.text: In Minecraft, you can have your own ranch filled with livestock! Ranching provides lots of resources such as wool, eggs, and raw meat.

howtoplay.ranching.text.2.text: In order to keep your livestock growing, you have to make baby animals. Adult animals must enter Love Mode for this to happen. Feed the animals their preferred food to get them to enter Love Mode.

howtoplay.ranching.text.3.text: When two like animals are nearby and in Love Mode, they will kiss for a moment and then a baby animal will appear! The baby animal will stay with their parents until they grow into an adult. After having a baby, adult animals must wait 5 minutes before entering Love Mode.

howtoplay.ranching.text.4.text: Cows, mooshrooms, and sheep all eat Wheat. Pigs can eat Carrots or Beetroot. Chickens love Seeds of any kinds. Rabbits will eat Carrots, Golden Carrots, or Dandelions. Ocelots enjoy Raw Cod or Salmon. Wolves like to eat any kind of meat.

howtoplay.ranching.text.5.text: Animals will follow you when you hold their desired food item. This will help you lead them to your ranch or another animal.

howtoplay.realms_stories.header.4.text: Know who is on the Realm

howtoplay.realms_stories.text.1.text: A social hub for you and all the members of the Realm. Share your adventures and creations by posting stories to the Story Feed, like and comment to celebrate stories posted by other members.

howtoplay.realms_stories.text.2.text: Clicking the ADD STORY button on the Story Feed will let you write a story of your own. You can choose to include a screenshot or text (or both!). Clicking the POST button will post your text/screenshot to the Story Feed for all the Realm's members to enjoy. If you don't have any screenshots to post, use the §ecamera§f:camera: on the game menu to capture the moment.

howtoplay.realms_stories.text.3.text: Whenever there is a new story in the Feed that you haven't read yet, a number will appear on the REALMS STORIES button. You'll always know when there is something new to read from your Realm's community. If you like what someone shared, go ahead and leave them a like or comment on their story!

howtoplay.realms_stories.text.4.text: See who's playing and when in the Timeline. Scroll through the members of the Realm to see when they played last and who they played with. Use this information to set up times when you can all play together.

howtoplay.realms_stories.text.5.text: Get to know who is part of the Realm by using the Members tab. It's a list of all the players who can play here. You can see who the Realm owner is, who the operators are, and who has joined Realms Stories for this Realm. There are search, sort, and filter options to help you find exactly who you're looking for.

howtoplay.realms_stories.text.6.text: Realms Stories is available in the game menu when you're playing in the Realm and on the Realms Tab. You can keep up to date and tell your story from anywhere you are, even when you aren't playing. From your console, computer, and mobile device, Realms Stories is available everywhere.

howtoplay.recipeBook.text.1.gamepad.text: Don't worry, you don't need to remember every recipe by heart. The §erecipe book§f in your inventory keeps track of blocks and items you can craft - simply select a recipe to see what you need to craft it.

howtoplay.recipeBook.text.1.keyboard.text: Don't worry, you don't need to remember every recipe by heart. The §erecipe book§f in your inventory keeps track of blocks and items you can craft - simply click a recipe to see what you need to craft it.

howtoplay.recipeBook.text.1.touch.text: Don't worry, you don't need to remember every recipe by heart. The §erecipe book§f in your inventory keeps track of blocks and items you can craft - simply tap a recipe to see what you need to craft it.

howtoplay.recipeBook.text.2.gamepad.text: Once you've gathered the required crafting ingredients, select the recipe once more, then move it from the output slot to your hotbar or inventory.

howtoplay.recipeBook.text.2.keyboard.text: Once you've gathered the required crafting ingredients, click the recipe once more, then move it from the output slot to your hotbar or inventory.

howtoplay.recipeBook.text.2.touch.text: Once you've gathered the required crafting ingredients, tap the recipe once more, then move it from the output slot to your hotbar or inventory.

howtoplay.redstone.text.1.text: Redstone Dust comes from Redstone that transmits an electrical signal. When it has power it lights up and transmits its signal to other Redstone items that are next to it.

howtoplay.redstone.text.2.text: In order for one of these items to be powered, it needs a power source such as a Lever, Button, or Pressure Plate. Experiment to find them all!

howtoplay.redstone.text.3.text: Place some Redstone Dust next to a power source and turn it on to power it.

howtoplay.redstone.text.4.text: There are many items that use a Redstone signal to do something, such as a Hopper or a Piston.

howtoplay.redstone.text.5.text: Redstone allows for endless possibilities! Try creating something useful for yourself like an automatic farm!

howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1.gamepad.text: Scaffolding can help you create huge structures safely! You can walk inside scaffolding and stand on it. If you have a column of scaffolding you can go upward by standing in the scaffolding and pressing :_input_key.jump:. If you want to travel downward you can press and hold :_input_key.sneak:.

howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1.keyboard.text: Scaffolding can help you create huge structures safely! You can walk inside scaffolding and stand on it. If you have a column of scaffolding you can go upward by standing in the scaffolding and pressing :_input_key.jump:. If you want to travel downward you can press :_input_key.sneak:.

howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1.rift_contro.text: Scaffolding can help you create huge structures safely! You can walk inside scaffolding and stand on it. If you have a column of scaffolding you can go upward by standing in the scaffolding and pressing :rift_A:. If you want to travel downward you can press and hold :rift_X:.

howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1.windowsmr_c.text: Scaffolding can help you create huge structures safely! You can walk inside scaffolding and stand on it. If you have a column of scaffolding you can go upward by standing in the scaffolding and pressing :windowsmr_right_touchpad:. If you want to travel downward you can press and hold :windowsmr_right_stick:.

howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1a.touch.text: Scaffolding can help with building large structures by offering a way to reach higher places and safely descend without taking fall damage.

howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1b.touch.text: When using the D-Pad control scheme, tap :touch_jump: to climb up a column of scaffolding. Tap :touch_fly_down: to climb down.

howtoplay.scaffolding.text.1c.touch.text: When using a Joystick control scheme, press :tip_virtual_button_jump: to climb up a column of scaffolding. Tap :tip_virtual_button_sneak: to climb down.

howtoplay.scaffolding.text.2.text: Scaffolding needs support. You can only place so many scaffolding horizontally without touching a different block. When you attempt to place too many scaffolding blocks without proper support, it will fall. Scaffolding can be placed like normal blocks, but it can also be placed on its own foundation to quickly build a tall tower.

howtoplay.scaffolding.text.3.text: When Scaffolding is broken it will also break every Scaffolding block that was being supported by it. This will let you quickly clean up your scaffolding by breaking the supporting blocks!

howtoplay.selectingItems.text.1.text: Resources you pick up will appear in your §ehotbar§f, which you'll find at the bottom of the screen.

howtoplay.selectingItems.text.2.gamepad.text: To hold an item in your hand, use :_input_key.cycleItemLeft: and :_input_key.cycleItemRight: to select the item.

howtoplay.selectingItems.text.2.keyboard.text: To hold an item in your hand, scroll the mouse wheel to select the item. You can also use a number key: 1 is the first hotbar slot and 9 is the last.

howtoplay.selectingItems.text.2.rift.text: To hold an item in your hand, use :rift_left_trigger: and :rift_left_grab: to select the item.

howtoplay.selectingItems.text.2.touch.text: To hold an item in your hand, simply tap it in the hotbar.

howtoplay.selectingItems.text.2.windowsm.text: To hold an item in your hand, use :windowsmr_left_touchpad_horizontal: to select the item.

howtoplay.selectingItems.text.3.nottouch.text: Some items, like buckets, fishing rods, and bows, can be used by tapping the build/use button :_input_key.use:.

howtoplay.selectingItems.text.3.touch.text: Some items, like buckets, fishing rods, and bows, can be used by touching and holding anywhere on the screen.

howtoplay.selectingItems.text.3.touch.jo.text: Some items, like buckets, fishing rods, and bows, can be used by tapping the build/use button :tip_virtual_button_action_build_or_use:.

howtoplay.shulkerBoxes.text.1.text: Combine two Shulker Shells with a Chest to create a Shulker Box. Shulker Shells are dropped by Shulkers found in End Cities. Unlike other containers, Shulker Boxes keep their items when broken. Shulker Boxes will break and drop as an item if pushed by Pistons, and can be placed using Dispensers.

howtoplay.skins.text.1.text: Put on some fresh pixels and express yourself with a huge variety of inspired looks.

howtoplay.smithing_table.text.1.text: Want to get the most out of your equipment? You'll need a Smithing Table.

howtoplay.smithing_table.text.2.text: Use it to make all kinds of changes, for example by upgrading Diamond equipment to Netherite, or by making cosmetic changes with Armor Trims.

howtoplay.smithing_table.text.3.text: In order to upgrade your equipment, you'll need a Smithing Template. You can find a large variety throughout the world, which can be used for all kinds of upgrades.

howtoplay.smithing_table.text.4.text: Place a Template into the leftmost slot of a Smithing Table to see which items you need for the upgrade.

howtoplay.smithing_table.text.5.text: For example, to upgrade Diamond equipment to Netherite, you need a Netherite Upgrade Smithing Template, which you can find in Bastion Remnants. Then, place the Diamond equipment in the equipment slot and a Netherite ingot in the ingredient slot, and you're done!

howtoplay.smithing_table.text.6.text: Item properties such as enchantments and armor trims will be retained, but the Smithing Template will be consumed when you upgrade your equipment. Don't worry - you can craft copies of them with your Crafting Table.

howtoplay.smithing_table.text.7.text: Get creative and customize the look of your armor with Armor Trims. You'll need an Armor Trim Smithing Template to get started, which you can find throughout the world.

howtoplay.smithing_table.text.8.text: Place a Template into the leftmost slot of a Smithing Table to see which items you need for the upgrade. Then place a piece of armor in the equipment slot and a crystal or ingot in the ingredient slot. Done!

howtoplay.smithing_table.text.9.text: Only certain crystals and ingots can be used for Armor Trims. Try different kinds like Iron, Gold, or Lapis to create unique designs!

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.1.text: Structure Blocks give creators the ability to copy and save out sections of their world into structures. Saved structures can then be pasted back into the world.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.10.text: Redstone can be used to activate a Structure Block. This will cause it to either save a structure out or load a structure into the world, depending on the mode of the block and its settings.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.11.text: You can change how much of a structure is loaded in by changing the values for Integrity and Seed.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.12.text: Integrity - the percentage of blocks to load in from the structure, accepted values are 0 to 100. Blocks will be chosen randomly if a Seed is not specified.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.13.text: Seed - the value entered here will determine which blocks to remove when using Integrity. Leave this field blank if you want the blocks to be chosen randomly.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.14.text: When a structure with Structure Void blocks is loaded into the world, any block that would have been removed where the structure void block is loading into, will instead stay in the world.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.15.text: Example: loading an empty shipwreck into the bottom of the ocean will normally copy air over the water blocks. If the shipwreck was filled with structure void, then the water will stay, and you will have a shipwreck filled with water.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.16.text: To automatically select the area you want to save, you can place Corner Mode blocks around your structure and name them with the same name as the structure you want to save.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.17.text: Pressing the Detect button in Save mode will find all of the Corner Blocks with the same name and create a selection area so that it will save everything inside of the volume those Corner Blocks make.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.2.text: To get a Structure Block you must use the /give slash command. To use a Structure Block, you must have Operator permissions.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.3.text: Structure Blocks have 4 modes that can be switched between with the Mode dropdown: Save, Load, Corner, and 3D Export.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.4.text: Save mode saves an area of the world as a structure.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.5.text: Load mode loads a structure into the world. Only structures saved to the world or included in a behavior pack that is applied to the world can be loaded.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.6.text: Corner mode is used with save mode's detect button to automatically set the area you want to save. See the Corner Mode section below for more details.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.7.text: 3D Export exports a 3D model file on supported platforms.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.8.text: On the right side of the Structure Block screen, a preview of the area you have selected or the structure to load will appear depending on the mode the block is in.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.9.keyboar.text: Press :_input_key.attack: and drag, to rotate the 3D preview.

howtoplay.structureBlocks.text.9.touch.text: Touch and drag on the preview to rotate the 3D preview.

howtoplay.textures.text.1.text: Texture packs visually transform the game's appearance, applying a fresh coat of paint to your Minecraft world.

howtoplay.theCraftingTable.text.1.text: Ready to take your crafting to the next level? Place four planks in a square in your crafting grid, and you'll get a §ecrafting table§f :crafting_table: - a whole new way to craft.

howtoplay.theCraftingTable.text.2.gamepa.text: Place your crafting table in the world, then walk up to it and press :_input_key.use: to open it. The larger crafting grid will let you make bigger and better things, including tools, beds, and doors.

howtoplay.theCraftingTable.text.2.keyboa.text: Place your crafting table in the world, then right-click it to open it. The larger crafting grid will let you make bigger and better things, including tools, beds, and doors.

howtoplay.theCraftingTable.text.2.touch.text: Place your crafting table in the world, then tap it to open it. The larger crafting grid will let you make bigger and better things, including tools, beds, and doors.

howtoplay.theCraftingTable.title.text: How to Play: The Crafting Table

howtoplay.theEnd.text.1.text: The End is another dimension which can be accessed through an active End Portal. The End Portal can be found in a Stronghold, which is deep underground in the Overworld.

howtoplay.theEnd.text.2.text: Every End Portal frame block is missing something mysterious to bring out the power within.

howtoplay.theEnd.text.3.text: Once the portal is active, jump into it to go to The End.

howtoplay.theEnd.text.4.text: The End is home to the dreaded Ender Dragon. She is a fierce and powerful enemy and seems to draw power from strange crystals. Her breath and fireball attacks leave lingering acid across the battlefield. Bring some friends to ensure your victory!

howtoplay.theEnd.text.5.text: If once wasn't enough, add four Ender Crystals to the exit portal corners to reawaken the Ender Dragon.

howtoplay.tools.text.1.text: There are many tools in Minecraft that will allow you mine blocks faster than your fist. Tools can be crafted from Wood, Stone, Iron, Gold, Diamond, or Netherite.

howtoplay.tools.text.10.text: Flint & Steel allows you to light fires... be careful in densely wooded areas!

howtoplay.tools.text.11.text: A Fishing Rod lets you catch fish and other loot from water blocks. It can also be used to pull other players and mobs. Fishing Rods can also be enchanted!

howtoplay.tools.text.12.text: Shears are very handy for collecting items like Wool, Leaves, and Cobwebs.

howtoplay.tools.text.2.text: Using the right tool for the job will not only mine that block faster, but will also lose less durability. More complex tools must be created in order to mine rarer resources.

howtoplay.tools.text.3.text: The Pickaxe is good at breaking hard blocks like Cobblestone, Iron, or Furnaces.

howtoplay.tools.text.4.text: The Axe is good at breaking wooden blocks like Logs, Planks, or Crafting Tables.
