howtoplay.tools.text.5.notTouch.text: The Shovel is good at breaking loose blocks like Dirt, Sand, and Gravel. Shovels can also create a path by pressing :_input_key.use: on grass blocks.

howtoplay.tools.text.5.touch.text: The Shovel is good at breaking loose blocks like Dirt, Sand, and Gravel. Shovels can also create a path by tapping on grass blocks.

howtoplay.tools.text.6.notTouch.text: The Hoe is required for tilling Dirt to plant crops. Press :_input_key.use: on Dirt or Grass blocks to turn them into Farmland.

howtoplay.tools.text.6.touch.text: The Hoe is required for tilling Dirt to plant crops. Tap Dirt or Grass blocks to turn them into Farmland.

howtoplay.tools.text.7.text: All of these tools can accept enchantments, either from the Enchanting Table or Anvil.

howtoplay.tools.text.8.text: There are even more tools to aid you on your adventure:

howtoplay.tools.text.9.text: A Bucket will allow you to collect things like Water, Milk, Lava, and even Fish.

howtoplay.trading.text.1.text: Trading can be done in villages. Each villager has a profession; they can be Farmers, Butchers, Blacksmiths, Cartographers, Librarians, or Priests. Some professions will trade for items that other professions cannot. Explore and trade with many villagers to find all the trades.

howtoplay.trading.text.2.text: You can find out what a villager is offering as trade by interacting with them. A villager may adjust the price of a trade whenever a player trades with it. A villager may run out of stock, temporarily disabling the trade if it is used too frequently. Trades usually involve buying or selling items for emeralds.

howtoplay.trading.text.3.text: As you trade with villagers, they will get better at their profession and start to offer better and more valuable trades.

howtoplay.trading.text.4.text: Take care of your villagers, they need to rest, work, and eat to thrive.

howtoplay.transportation.text.1.text: There are many ways to get around other than walking or riding a mount or flying.

howtoplay.transportation.text.2.text: Minecarts are ridable carts that roll on Rails. You can make the Rails go wherever you want by placing them next to each other. Place a Minecart on the Rails and you are ready to ride.

howtoplay.transportation.text.2.touch.text: Minecarts are ridable carts that roll on Rails, which you can build to go anywhere. Just place multiple Rails next to each other, place a Minecart on it, and you're ready to ride.

howtoplay.transportation.text.3.gamepad.text: Press :_input_key.use: while looking at a Minecart to hop in and ride. Push :_gamepad_stick_left: forward to roll forward. Press :_input_key.jump: or :_input_key.sneak: to get out.

howtoplay.transportation.text.3.keyboard.text: Press :_input_key.use: while looking at a Minecart to hop in and ride. Press :_input_key.forward: to roll forward. Press :_input_key.jump: or :_input_key.sneak: to get out.

howtoplay.transportation.text.3a.touch.text: Look at a Minecart and tap "Ride" to hop in.

howtoplay.transportation.text.3b.touch.text: When using the D-Pad control scheme, tap and hold :touch_forward: to start moving forward and build momentum, and tap :touch_jump: to get out.

howtoplay.transportation.text.3c.touch.text: When using a Joystick control scheme, drag :tip_virtual_joystick: up to start moving forward and build momentum, and tap :tip_virtual_button_dismount: to get out.

howtoplay.transportation.text.4.text: Boats let you travel across water. Place one on a water block and you are ready to go.

howtoplay.transportation.text.4.touch.text: Boats let you travel across water. Just place one on a water block and you're ready to go.

howtoplay.transportation.text.5.gamepad.text: Press :_input_key.use: while looking at a Boat to board it. Push :_gamepad_stick_left: left or right to turn. Push :_gamepad_stick_left: forward to move forward. Press :_input_key.jump: or :_input_key.sneak: to get out.

howtoplay.transportation.text.5.keyboard.text: Press :_input_key.use: while looking at a Boat to board it. Press :_input_key.left: or :_input_key.right: to turn left or right. Press :_input_key.forward: to move forward. Press :_input_key.jump: or :_input_key.sneak: to get out.

howtoplay.transportation.text.5a.touch.text: Look at a Boat and tap "Board" to board it.

howtoplay.transportation.text.5b.touch.text: When using the D-Pad control scheme, tap :touch_left: or :touch_right: to turn left or right, or tap and hold both to move forward. Tap "Leave Boat" to get out.

howtoplay.transportation.text.5c.touch.text: When using a Joystick control scheme, drag :tip_virtual_joystick: up to move forward and tap :tip_virtual_button_dismount: to get out.

howtoplay.weapons.text.1.text: The Sword is the primary melee weapon in Minecraft. It can be made from Wood, Stone, Iron, Gold, Diamond, or Netherite. Jump attacks do critical damage!

howtoplay.weapons.text.2.notTouch.text: Press :_input_key.attack: with a Sword in your hand to attack.

howtoplay.weapons.text.3.notTouch.text: The Bow is the primary ranged weapon in Minecraft. Press and hold :_input_key.use: to draw the bow back. Release :_input_key.use: to fire an arrow. The bow requires arrows to fire.

howtoplay.weapons.text.3.touch.text: The Bow is the primary ranged weapon in Minecraft. Press and hold the Screen to draw the bow back. Release the press to fire an arrow. The bow requires arrows to fire.

howtoplay.weapons.text.4.text: Bows do more damage the further they are pulled back, make sure to pull it all the way back.

howtoplay.weapons.text.5.notTouch.text: The Crossbow is an alternate ranged weapon. Press and hold :_input_key.use: to load the crossbow. Once the Crossbow is loaded, it will stay loaded until it is fired. Press :_input_key.use: to fire an arrow. The Crossbow requires arrows to load.

howtoplay.weapons.text.5a.touch.text: The crossbow is a ranged weapon which requires an arrow to be loaded. Tap and hold anywhere on the screen to load the crossbow with an arrow.

howtoplay.weapons.text.5b.touch.text: Once you've loaded the crossbow it'll stay loaded until fired, even when you put it in your inventory.

howtoplay.weapons.text.5c.touch.text: Tap anywhere on the screen to fire a loaded crossbow.

howtoplay.weapons.text.5d.touch.text: If you're using Action Buttons, tap :tip_virtual_button_action_build_or_use: to fire a loaded crossbow.

howtoplay.weapons.text.6.notTouch.text: The Trident is a dual-purpose melee and ranged weapon. Press :_input_key.attack: to attack. Press and hold :_input_key.use: to draw the trident back. Release :_input_key.use: to throw the trident. The Trident is the best weapon underwater.

howtoplay.weapons.text.6.touch.text: The Trident is a dual-purpose melee and ranged weapon. Tap mobs to attack them. Press and hold the Screen to draw the trident back. Release the press to throw the trident. The Trident is the best weapon underwater.

howtoplay.weapons.text.7.text: The Sword, Bow, Crossbow, and Trident have specific enchantments that you can get from the Enchanting Table or Anvil that will improve damage, durability and even light mobs on fire!

howtoplay.worldBuilder.text.1.text: To place or use certain Minecraft Education blocks or items, a player must possess a special ability called 'World Builder'.

howtoplay.worldBuilder.text.2.text: With cheats activated, the host can enable or disable the World Builder ability for any players in the world.

howtoplay.worldBuilder.text.3.text: To grant World Builder ability to all players in the world, run the following command:

howtoplay.worldBuilder.text.5.text: To quickly toggle your own World Builder ability, run either of the following commands:

howtoplay.worldBuilder.text.8.text: To query your World Builder ability, run the following command:

howtoplay.worlds.text.1.text: Worlds in the Minecraft Marketplace Minecraft levels where our partners have altered the terrain and placed new blocks to create amazing structures and terrain for you to explore and enjoy.

howtoplay.worlds.text.10.text: You can not break blocks or place new blocks in these worlds.

howtoplay.worlds.text.11.text: Dynamic Worlds allow you to explore the creative designs of our marketplace creators in a randomly generated map.

howtoplay.worlds.text.12.text: Worlds can have new biomes, customized structures (randomly generated buildings), new blocks, textures, and mobs.

howtoplay.worlds.text.2.text: Worlds can also include new items, mobs, blocks and even custom gameplay.

howtoplay.worlds.text.3.text: All of the content in the Marketplace is created by our professional commiunity creators.

howtoplay.worlds.text.4.text: Worlds can do so much, we've created several Sub-Categories to help describe what they can do:

howtoplay.worlds.text.5.text: Mini-Games are smaller worlds that include new game mechanics, challenges, or rules.

howtoplay.worlds.text.6.text: These games are made with multiplayer in mind, letting you test your skills and have fun with your friends.

howtoplay.worlds.text.7.text: Survival Spawns let you start playing in a custom-built world, while still enjoying the classic survival mechanics of Minecraft.

howtoplay.worlds.text.8.text: Just like in Survival mode you will have health and hunger, and need to fight dangerous mobs.

howtoplay.worlds.text.9.text: Adventure Maps let you use Minecraft to play a totally different kind of game.

howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.1.text: Many blocks, like wood, can be turned into useful items by crafting. To do this, you'll find a simple §ecrafting grid§f on the right-hand side of your inventory screen.

howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.2.text: For example, put a single wood log anywhere on the crafting grid, and several planks will appear in the §eoutput slot§f.

howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.3.gamepad.text: Simply select your shiny new planks and they will appear in your hotbar. Now you're ready to place them into the world!

howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.3.keyboard.text: Simply drag your shiny new planks to your hotbar. Now you're ready to place them into the world!

howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.3.touch.text: Simply tap your shiny new planks and they will appear in your hotbar. Now you're ready to place them into the world!

howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.4.text: Some items require you to place your crafting ingredients in a certain shape - also called a §erecipe§f.

howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.text.5.text: Try placing two planks above each other to create some sticks. Useful for all sorts of things!

howtoplay.yourFirstCraft.title.text: How to Play: Your First Craft

lategameTips.1.text: Zombified piglins won't attack you - unless you make them angry.

lategameTips.10.text: A Spider Jockey is the rare appearance of a spider being ridden by a skeleton!

lategameTips.11.text: Traveling one block in the Nether is equal to traveling eight blocks in the Overworld.

lategameTips.12.text: Use phantom membranes to repair your elytra.

lategameTips.13.text: Elytra can be used to glide, find them in End city ships!

lategameTips.14.text: Test out some new features by turning on Experimental Gameplay in the settings menu!

lategameTips.15.text: Monsters that are killed by skeletons arrows have a chance of dropping music discs.

lategameTips.16.text: Texture packs change the way that blocks, items, and even the menus look in game. Try them out!

lategameTips.17.text: Using firework rockets boosts elytra speed in mid air. Just... make sure they don't explode, otherwise it'll hurt BADLY!

lategameTips.19.text: Riptide enchantment will propel you through the air in the rain.

lategameTips.2.text: Hit those fireballs back at the Ghast!

lategameTips.20.text: The Beacon is a powerful item that can only be crafted with a Nether star from the Wither!

lategameTips.21.text: Nether stars can't be destroyed by explosions.

lategameTips.23.text: Respawning in the Nether requires a charged respawn anchor.

lategameTips.24.text: You can charge a respawn anchor with glowstone.

lategameTips.25.text: You can breed hoglins with crimson fungus, but be careful.

lategameTips.26.text: Gold is most common in the Nether and in the badlands biome.

lategameTips.27.text: Diorite, you either love it or hate it.

lategameTips.3.text: Cobblestone is resistant to Ghast fireballs, making it useful for guarding portals.

lategameTips.4.text: Our music is by C418, Lena Raine, Aaron Cherof, and Kumi Tanioka.

lategameTips.5.text: There will be an update to this game eventually!

lategameTips.6.text: Creepers were born from a coding bug.

lategameTips.7.text: The first version of Minecraft was created in just 6 days!

lategameTips.8.text: The Enderman language is actually English in reverse.

lategameTips.9.text: The original name for Minecraft was Cave Game.

menu.howToPlay.access.noicon.text: Press [A] to open How to Play!

menu.howToPlay.generalMessage.text: Minecraft encyclopedia for new and experienced players.

menu.simulating.text: Simulating the world for a bit

menu.trialLabel.text: Jump into trial mode and explore, gather and craft - all free, for a limited time.

midgameTips.1.text: Iron golems will fight for you!

midgameTips.10.text: Obsidian is created when water hits a lava source block.

midgameTips.11.text: If the source block for water or lava is removed, it will stop the flow completely.

midgameTips.12.text: Blocks that can be used as a light source will melt snow and ice.

midgameTips.13.text: Take caution when building structures made of wool out in the open, as lightning from thunderstorms can set wool on fire.

midgameTips.14.text: A single bucket of lava can be used in a furnace to smelt 100 blocks.

midgameTips.15.text: The instrument played by a note block depends on the material beneath it.

midgameTips.16.text: Attacking a wolf will cause any wolves nearby to turn hostile and attack you.

midgameTips.17.text: Wolves and iron golems won't attack creepers.

midgameTips.18.text: Chickens lay an egg every 5 to 10 minutes.

midgameTips.19.text: Obsidian can be mined with a diamond pickaxe.

midgameTips.2.text: Feed a bone to a wolf to tame it. You can then make it sit or follow you.

midgameTips.20.text: Creepers are the easiest obtainable source of gunpowder.

midgameTips.21.text: Tame wolves show their health with the position of their tail. Feed them meat to heal them.

midgameTips.22.text: Different colored dyes can be made from a variety of materials, cook cactus in a furnace to get green dye!

midgameTips.23.text: Pigs that are struck by lightning become zombified piglins.

midgameTips.25.text: Sometimes iron golems give flowers to the villager children!

midgameTips.27.text: Use seagrass to attract and breed sea turtles.

midgameTips.28.text: Protect baby turtles from hostile mobs!

midgameTips.29.text: Baby turtles will drop scutes when they grow - these can be crafted into turtle shells.

midgameTips.3.text: Wearing a pumpkin on your head will keep Endermen from attacking you.

midgameTips.30.text: Brew some water breathing potions for underwater exploration!

midgameTips.31.text: Dolphins can lead you to shipwrecks and underwater ruins, feed them cod and follow their trail!

midgameTips.32.text: Use shears to carve a pumpkin.

midgameTips.33.text: There are 3587 types of tropical fish!

midgameTips.34.text: Sea pickles can be smelted into lime green dye.

midgameTips.35.text: Use hay bales to breed Llamas!

midgameTips.36.text: Compasses always point to the world spawn - craft one to find your way!

midgameTips.37.text: Trade with villagers to obtain food, tools, and even explorer maps!

midgameTips.38.text: Did you know you can hold a map in your off-hand?

midgameTips.39.text: Leads can be used on boats.

midgameTips.4.text: Harvest leather from cows, and use it to make armor and books.

midgameTips.40.text: Sneak to walk safely on magma blocks.

midgameTips.41.text: You can gather cobwebs using shears.

midgameTips.42.text: Tridents are dropped by the Drowned, and can be held or thrown.

midgameTips.43.text: You can smelt 20 items in a furnace by using a block of dried kelp as fuel.

midgameTips.44.text: Taming a skeleton horse doesn't require a saddle.

midgameTips.45.text: Phantoms are dangerous mobs that appear during the night. Make sure to sleep regularly!

midgameTips.46.text: Zombies turn into drowned if they sink underwater.

midgameTips.5.text: You can fill an empty bucket with water, lava, milk, powdered snow... and even some mobs.

midgameTips.50.text: When digging straight up, place a torch at your feet to break any sand or gravel that could potentially fall down on you.

midgameTips.51.text: Shear a Beehive or nest to get Honeycomb, use a Bottle to get honey.

midgameTips.52.text: Place a campfire under a beehive or nest to harvest honey.

midgameTips.53.text: Emerald ores are the rarest ores in Minecraft! They can only be found in mountains and meadows.

midgameTips.54.text: Need diamonds? They get more common as you go deeper.

midgameTips.55.text: Frogs eat small and blocky mobs.

midgameTips.56.text: The Allay loves to collect items! If you give it a certain item it will try to collect more of it.

midgameTips.57.text: Frogs pick a variant based on the temperature of the biome the tadpole grow up in.

midgameTips.58.text: You can collect tadpoles in buckets.

midgameTips.59.text: Ancient cities can be found under mountain ranges.

midgameTips.6.text: Feeding an animal will keep it from despawning. Build a pen to keep your animals safe.

midgameTips.60.text: Allays love music and therefore interact with noteblocks!

midgameTips.61.text: Use a water bottle on a dirt block to get mud!

midgameTips.62.text: When wandering in the deep dark, silence is key.

midgameTips.63.text: Some animals will follow you if you have wheat in your hand.

midgameTips.64.text: Before you mine diamonds, redstone, or gold, make sure you're using an iron or diamond pickaxe or it won't work.

midgameTips.65.text: Placing two chests side by side will make one large chest.

midgameTips.66.text: Can't find any coal for your torches? Try putting some logs in a furnace.

midgameTips.68.text: Plant some saplings and they'll grow into trees.

midgameTips.69.text: Use a hoe to prepare areas of ground for planting.

midgameTips.7.text: Get to your destination faster with a minecart and some rails!

midgameTips.8.text: Building a portal will allow you to travel to another dimension called the Nether.

midgameTips.9.text: Bonemeal (crafted from a skeleton bone) can be used as a fertilizer and can make things grow instantly!

store.csb.faq.answer1.text: Marketplace Pass is subscription service that gives you access to 150+ pieces of content from Minecraft Marketplace for %s/month.

store.csb.faq.answer2.text: Select content refreshes each month so there’s always something new to explore.

store.csb.faq.answer3.text: Access to Marketplace Pass requires an active subscription, and a compatible version of Minecraft: Bedrock Edition with Minecraft Marketplace. Requires Microsoft account sign-in.

store.csb.faq.answer4.text: Once a world, texture pack, skin pack, or mash-up leaves the catalog, you will need to purchase the item from the Marketplace to continue playing. Packs will not be deleted from your local storage until you delete them. Monthly character creator items you’ve redeemed are yours to keep.

store.csb.faq.answer5.text: You will be able to purchase and download any world templates saved to your cloud storage within 18 months of ending your subscription unless they are no longer offered by Minecraft. Monthly character creator items you’ve redeemed are yours to keep.

store.csb.faq.answer6.text: The difference between the two subscriptions is that Realms Plus includes a personal server where you can play with up to ten friends at a time. The content catalog you have access to with your Marketplace Pass subscription is the same catalog that is available with a Realms Plus subscription.

store.csb.faq.answer7.text: A Realms Plus subscription includes Marketplace Pass. If you are subscribed to Marketplace Pass and want to explore Realms Plus, we suggest that you unsubscribe from Marketplace Pass first. Active Realms Plus subscribers are unable to subscribe to Marketplace Pass.

store.csb.faq.answer8.text: If you purchase Marketplace Pass, you can access all the packs from any device with a  compatible version of Minecraft: Bedrock Edition with Minecraft Marketplace (sold separately) if you’re signed into your Minecraft account. Not supported on Amazon Kindle Fire or Minecraft Java Edition.

store.csb.faq.answer9.text: You will be able to see content in your subscription if you are already subscribed, but you will not be able to subscribe to Marketplace Pass from the Preview/BETA build.

store.csb.subscription.text: After sign up, 150+ pieces of exciting Minecraft Marketplace content will be available to you. Download and play adventure maps, wear skins, dive into texture packs, and even claim a set of Character Creator items to keep each month. With a catalog that’s regularly refreshed, there’s always something new to discover with Marketplace Pass. You’ll be billed %s/month and can cancel anytime to stop future charges.

store.csb.terms.text: Marketplace Pass is a subscription for content to be used with supported versions of Minecraft (game sold separately) on Windows and other supported platforms on which you own the game (Minecraft Java & Amazon Kindle Fire Editions not supported); an active subscription is required to use Marketplace Pass content. Content varies over time and may not be available in all countries. After the free trial period, subscription continues to be charged at the then-current regular price (subject to change) plus applicable taxes unless cancelled. You can cancel your subscription by accessing Services & subscriptions in your Microsoft account. If your subscription terminates or a content item is removed from the catalog, you must reactivate your subscription or buy the content separately to continue using it. ISP fees may apply. We may occasionally provide content that remains available to you even after the end of your subscription, in which case we reserve the right to take down such content if it becomes incompatible or if our rights to the content expire. Subscription subject to change and/or retirement. Subject to the Microsoft Services Agreement (www.microsoft.com/msa) and the Minecraft EULA (https://www.minecraft.net/eula). Any translations of these terms are done for your convenience only, and in the event of a dispute between the English and any non-English versions, the English version of these terms shall govern.

store.realmsPlus.content.contentDescript.text: Tap into the source of amazing Minecraft content! With Realms Plus, you get instant access to 150+ marketplace items like mash-ups, worlds, skin packs and epic adventures – with new additions each month. Your content is stored on your own personal server, and made available on any platform where you enjoy both Realms and Minecraft Marketplace. Up to 10 players can play at one time, and they get access to the worlds in your Realm for free!

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer1.text: Realms Plus is a subscription to a personal server supporting up to 10 simultaneous players, along with unlimited access to 150+ great Minecraft worlds, texture packs, skin packs, and mash-ups for one low monthly price.

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer10.text: No. Marketplace Pass is a catalog of over 150+ packs for you to enjoy. Realms Plus is a 10 player Realm with Marketplace Pass included. We suggest that you subscribe to the one that’s right for you.

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer11.text: Realms Stories is a social hub for your Realm. Post to the Story Feed to let others know what you’re up to, and share your adventures and creations. Know who’s who with a handy list of all the members. See when other members are playing to check out their creations or plan to join them next time.

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer2.text: A personal server allows you to create a shared world that is always online and accessible from any device with Minecraft Marketplace. Players that you invite to your Realm can play this world at any time.

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer3.text: Your friends don’t need to purchase a Realms Plus subscription to play on your Realm. You can invite any friend (that has their multiplayer permissions enabled) to join your Realm for free.

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer4.text: Realms Plus is currently available on any platform where you can install Minecraft Bedrock Edition. You can play Realms and use any content from Realms Plus on any of these devices if you’re signed into your Microsoft account.

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer5.text: %s per month for a 10-player server and access to 150+ marketplace packs.

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer5.contentSub.text: %s per month. Add infinite members, play online with 10 other players at the same time. Plus, enjoy over 150 pieces of Marketplace content from the Marketplace Pass catalog for free.

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer6.text: New packs are added to Realms Plus monthly.

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer7.text: Realms Plus members enjoy unlimited access to over 150+ great Minecraft worlds, texture packs, skin packs, and mash-ups, until either the subscription expires, or a pack leaves the catalog.

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer8.text: Worlds and packs included in the subscription can either be played online, played on your personal Realm, or played on a local device. You just need to play online once every 30 days to validate that your subscription is active.

store.realmsPlus.faq.answer9.text: If your subscription ends, you and your friends will no longer be able to play online together on Realms, and you will no longer have access to Realms Plus packs. You can download any world saved to your Realm (within 18 months of ending your subscription). If you used Realms Plus worlds, texture packs, or mash-ups you will need to purchase those packs in the store or, if those packs are still in Realms Plus, re-subscribe, to play those world templates.

sunsetting.popup.pendingSunset.device.text: Our ability to support this device is coming to an end. You will continue to receive updates until March of 2025, when you will receive your final update for this device.%sAfter you receive the final update, you will still be able to play on your worlds, and access Marketplace purchases (including Minecoins). Realms managed with this device will continue to work for 6 months unless they are updated by the Realm owner on a different device.%sTo cancel your Realm subscription, you will need to do so in the Settings menu for Subscriptions on the device the Realm was created with.%sYou will no longer receive the latest updates and will be unable to play multiplayer with devices or Realms which are continuing to receive updates. You will also not be able to connect to certain servers.%sClick on the button for more information.

sunsetting.popup.pendingSunset.windows_x.text: Our ability to support this VR/MR graphic device has come to an end. This device will no longer be supported in updates after March of 2025, when you will receive your final update supporting this device.%sAfter you receive the final update, you will still receive updates on your PC and be able to play without a VR/MR device. From this point on you can keep building in your worlds, and your Marketplace purchases (including Minecoins) will continue to be available on a non-VR/MR graphics devices such as a computer monitor. You will no longer be able to use your VR/MR device with Minecraft as it will no longer be supported in the latest updates.%sClick on the button for more information.

sunsetting.popup.sunset.device.text: Our ability to support this device has come to an end. You will no longer receive updates as of March of 2025, and this is your final update for this device.%sYou will still be able to play on your worlds, and access Marketplace purchases (including Minecoins). Realms managed with this device will continue to work for 6 months from March of 2025 unless they are updated by the Realm owner on a different device.%sTo cancel your Realm subscription, you will need to do so in the Settings menu for Subscriptions on the device the Realm was created with.%sYou will no longer receive the latest updates and will be unable to play multiplayer with devices or Realms which are continuing to receive updates. You will also not be able to connect to certain servers.%sClick on the button for more information.

sunsetting.popup.sunset.windows_xr.text: Our ability to support this VR/MR graphic device has come to an end. This VR/MR device is no longer supported. You have received the final update supporting this graphics device, and you will still receive updates on your PC and be able to play without a VR/MR device. From this point on you can keep building in your worlds, and your Marketplace purchases (including Minecoins) will continue to be available on a non-VR/MR graphics devices such as a computer monitor. You will no longer be able to use your VR/MR device with Minecraft as it will no longer be supported in the latest updates.%sClick on the button for more information. We know this is an inconvenience, and deeply appreciate the time you spent with our game, and your support.

tips.edu.1.text: You can hold down Shift to take a close up picture using the Camera.

tips.edu.10.text: Looking for a specific biome? Try the Library.

tips.edu.12.text: In Survival Mode, players must find their own resources.

tips.edu.13.text: In Creative Mode, players can freely choose to build from any of the blocks in Minecraft.

tips.edu.14.text: Your code building robot helper is called the Agent.

tips.edu.15.text: Redstone can be used in Minecraft to create circuits and simple machines.

tips.edu.16.text: You can copy and paste from a text editor to a slate, poster, board, or into chat.

tips.edu.17.text: Show hints for commonly-used keyboard and mouse controls by pressing "H" on your keyboard.

tips.edu.18.text: You can toggle Auto Jump on or off in the Settings menu under Controls.

tips.edu.19.text: While in Creative Mode, quickly press jump twice to fly.

tips.edu.2.text: Unlike Signs, you can edit Slates, Posters, and Boards over and over again.

tips.edu.20.text: Choose a Default Game Mode when creating a world to specify the type of gameplay you want.

tips.edu.21.text: Use the command "/setworldspawn" to have new players begin playing where you are standing.

tips.edu.22.text: Choose a default player permission when creating your world to specify the permissions you want your classmates to have when they join.

tips.edu.23.text: Press "I" on your keyboard or touch the Immersive Reader icon to read or translate in-game text.

tips.edu.24.text: To add or change an NPC in your world, first make yourself a world builder with "/wb".

tips.edu.25.text: There's a brand new build challenge every month! Find them all in the Library under Monthly Build Challenges.

tips.edu.26.text: Find related lessons by clicking on tags in the Library.

tips.edu.27.text: Game moving slowly? Try turning down the render distance in Settings.

tips.edu.28.text: Want to use Code Builder? Make sure cheats are toggled on.

tips.edu.29.text: Press F5 to change player perspective.

tips.edu.3.text: Use Ctrl+B to turn on text-to-speech capabilities for in-game chat.

tips.edu.30.text: Use "/spawnpoint" to change your spawn point. It's just like you slept in a bed!

tips.edu.4.text: You can export your Minecraft world to share it with others.

tips.edu.5.text: To have your peers connect to your world, pause your game and share your join code.

tips.edu.6.text: Remember that to use slash commands, you need to enable cheats in your world.

tips.edu.7.text: Done with your creation? Have others tour your world as visitors to protect your work.

tips.edu.8.text: To code in Minecraft, press "C" on your keyboard or touch the Agent icon at the top of your screen.

tips.edu.9.text: Use the Library to find new game worlds to build in.

tips.realms.1.text: Take a screenshot using the Game menu.

tips.realms.2.text: A Realm is always online, so you and your friends can play here whenever you want.

tips.realms.3.text: Keep up to date with what's going on in your Realm by checking the Story Feed in Realms Stories.

tips.realms.4.text: Share your great moments with the other players on this Realm by adding a story to the Story Feed.

tips.realms.5.text: Check the Timeline in Realms Stories to find out when others are playing.

tips.realms.6.text: Access Realms Stories from the game menu while playing on the Realm.

tips.realms.7.text: Get to know your Realm's community on the Members tab in Realms Stories.

tips.realms.8.text: Use Realms Stories to get social, keep up with your friends' progress, and organize playtime.

trial.collection.1.description.text: Buy skins, textures and worlds in the Marketplace!

trial.collection.10.description.text: Make your worlds simple, colorful and vibrant!

trial.collection.11.description.text: Customize your character with this selection of skins!

trial.collection.12.description.text: Dress as a Cake Maniac, Frankencrafter, or Worse!

trial.collection.2.description.text: Buy skins, textures and worlds in the Marketplace!

trial.collection.3.description.text: Go on safari in a rugged off-road vehicle that seats 4!

trial.collection.4.description.text: Explore Noxcrew's magical world full of ancient castles!

trial.collection.5.description.text: Transform your Minecraft world into a comic!

trial.collection.6.description.text: Vast tropical wilderness on a whirlwind hunt for treasure!

trial.collection.7.description.text: Explore an ancient world, texture pack and skins!

trial.collection.8.description.text: Playgrounds filled with games and challenges!

trial.collection.9.description.text: Get ready for an explosion of rainbow pastel happiness!

trial.creative.mode.1.intro_description.text: Build anything you can imagine in Creative Mode. Take no damage, fly through the skies, and enjoy instant access to every block in the game! This mode lets you focus on crafting and gives you everything you need to build something beautiful!

trial.creative.mode.2.intro_description.text: You'll also have access to Inspiration Island, a tutorial world and introduction to Creative mode that'll teach you how to be a master builder in no time! You can find more great worlds like this in Minecraft Marketplace.

trial.master.offer.text: Get Minecraft, 1000 Minecoins, 4 skin packs, 2 texture packs, 3 maps, and 1 mash-up

trial.noInvitesOrJoining.text: To play with friends please purchase the full game

trial.starter.offer.text: Get Minecraft, 700 Minecoins, 2 skin packs, 1 texture pack and 1 mash-up

trial.survival.mode.1.intro_description.text: The original Minecraft experience: collect resources to craft tools and build structures, find and farm food to manage your hunger, battle dangerous mobs, and explore a vast world.

trial.survival.mode.2.intro_description.text: Start by collecting some wood and dirt for a makeshift home to help you survive the first night! From there it's all up to you.

trial.tabbed_upsell.achievements.descrip.text: In addition to the full Minecraft experience with Creative mode, Multiplayer, and more, you'll earn achievements and a Gamerscore to mark your Minecraft progress and show your Microsoft account friends your accomplishments. Get the full game to start earning them!

trial.tabbed_upsell.addon.description.text: Want to make wolves act like bunnies? Turn all the trees into cotton candy? You can alter everything in the full Minecraft experience with add-ons! Plus get access to Multiplayer, Creative mode, achievements and more! Buy Minecraft now for full access!

trial.tabbed_upsell.creative.description.text: Buy Minecraft and get Creative mode! Access the entire inventory - the only limit to what you can build is your imagination! Fly around your world, make your dream home out of anything and everything, or just blow up a mountain with unlimited TNT!

trial.tabbed_upsell.minecraft.descriptio.text: Endlessly explore your own unique worlds and construct anything you can imagine - from the simplest of homes to the grandest of castles! Play Creative mode to build wonders with unlimited resources. Or mine in Survival mode, crafting weapons and armor to fend off dangerous mobs and survive the nights. Plus, play with friends online! Unlock the full game today!

trial.tabbed_upsell.multiplayer.descript.text: The full Minecraft experience lets you enjoy Creative mode, achievements and Multiplayer with your friends across Minecraft devices! Play with friends on console, PC and mobile to create, explore and survive together. Unlock the full Minecraft experience today!

trial.tabbed_upsell.seeds.description.text: Unlock the full Minecraft experience and get access to Seeds! Seeds help you discover new biomes - survive on ice plains, ascend extreme hills, or trek across deserts. Start with unique templates or explore random new worlds! Access Seeds, Creative mode, Multiplayer and more by buying Minecraft today!

trial.tabbed_upsell.server.description.text: Servers offer some of the most creative ways to enjoy Minecraft! Play great mini-games, meet the Minecraft community and make new friends. Unlock the full Minecraft experience to try Servers today!

trial.tabbed_upsell.store.description.text: Get access to Minecraft Marketplace, our in-game store. Switch up your look with new skins, change your world, or explore incredible new maps from the best community creators! Get the full game today!

trial.tabbed_upsell.xbl.description.text: With the full Minecraft experience you get Creative mode, achievements, and more, plus with a Microsoft account you can meet others in the Minecraft community! Join your friends' worlds, make new friends on Servers, and sync your Marketplace purchases to everywhere you play Minecraft.

trial.thanks_for_testing.achievements.de.text: In addition to the full Minecraft experience with Creative mode, Multiplayer, and more, you'll earn achievements and a Gamerscore to mark your Minecraft progress and show your Microsoft account friends your accomplishments.

trial.thanks_for_testing.addon.descripti.text: Want to make wolves act like bunnies? Turn all the trees into cotton candy? You can alter everything in the full Minecraft experience with add-ons! Plus get access to Multiplayer, Creative mode, achievements and more!

trial.thanks_for_testing.creative.descri.text: A beloved part of the full Minecraft experience: Creative mode! Access the entire inventory - the only limit to what you can build is your imagination! Fly around your world, make your dream home out of anything and everything, or just blow up a mountain with unlimited TNT!

trial.thanks_for_testing.minecraft.descr.text: Thank you for downloading the Minecraft Trial for Chromebook! Your playtesting will provide invaluable data for bug fixes and technical troubleshooting. Uncover a bug? Report it at bugs.mojang.com! Other questions? Check out our FAQ.

trial.thanks_for_testing.multiplayer.des.text: The full Minecraft experience lets you enjoy Creative mode, achievements and Multiplayer with your friends across Minecraft devices! Play with friends on console, PC and mobile to create, explore and survive together.

trial.thanks_for_testing.seeds.descripti.text: The full Minecraft experience unlocks access to Seeds! Seeds help you discover new biomes - survive on ice plains, ascend extreme hills, or trek across deserts. Start with unique templates or explore random new worlds!

trial.thanks_for_testing.server.descript.text: As a part of the full Minecraft experience, Servers offer some of the most creative ways to enjoy Minecraft! Play great mini-games, meet the Minecraft community and make new friends.

trial.thanks_for_testing.store.descripti.text: The full game allows access to Minecraft Marketplace, our in-game store. Switch up your look with new skins, change your world, or explore incredible new maps from the best community creators!

trial.thanks_for_testing.xbl.description.text: With the full Minecraft experience, you get Creative mode, achievements, and more, plus with a Microsoft account you can meet others in the Minecraft community! You’ll be able to join friends’ worlds, make new friends on Servers, and sync your Marketplace purchases to everywhere you play Minecraft.

trial.upsell.cb.description.worldsDontTr.text: Explore, craft, build, and have fun! In this trial world, you will have 90 minutes of play time. Uncover a bug? Report it at bugs.mojang.com! Other questions? Check out our FAQ.
(Trial worlds do not transfer to the full game.)

trial.upsell.cb.expiredNewDescription.wo.text: Do you want to continue exploring, crafting, and building? Start a new trial world to continue playing!

trial.upsell.description.text: In this trial you are limited to 90 minutes of play time. Craft, build, explore, and have fun! Your world will be preserved if you choose to purchase the full version.

trial.upsell.description.updated.text: Explore, craft, build, and have fun! In this trial you will have 90 minutes of play time. Unlock the full game to continue playing as long as you want!

trial.upsell.description.worldsDontTrans.text: Explore, craft, build, and have fun! In this trial you will have 90 minutes of play time. Unlock the full game to play an infinite amount of worlds for as long as you want!*
*(This world will not transfer to the full game)

trial.upsell.expiredDescription.line1.text: Time has expired. Please purchase to unlock the full game:

trial.upsell.expiredNewDescription.text: Do you want to continue exploring, crafting, and building? Unlock the full game to play as long as you want! This world will be saved for you to pick up where you left off but you can't modify it until you unlock the full game.
